kaisa_1_scene_10_text: speaker_akali: You sure you’re okay with doing this, Kai?
kaisa_1_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s not like we have any other choice.
kaisa_1_scene_30_text: speaker_akali: I mean… you could come with us?
kaisa_1_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: You know I can’t. Someone has to look after Valoran City.
kaisa_1_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: Someone has to look after… them.
kaisa_1_scene_60_text: speaker_chiizu: I promise we won’t be a bother, Miss Kai’Sa.
kaisa_1_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not worried about you, Chiizu. But some of your friends…
kaisa_1_scene_90_text: speaker_akali: Umi didn’t appreciate what you were implying.
kaisa_1_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah… I heard. [Ouch. My ears.]
kaisa_1_scene_110_text: speaker_kaisa: But don’t worry, Akali. I didn’t really want to go on the field trip anyway…
kaisa_1_scene_120_text: speaker_akali: Because you hate fun?
kaisa_1_scene_140_text: speaker_akali: Hmph. Coulda fooled me.
kaisa_1_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: I went to the capital once when I was younger. Not much to see. Lots of buildings.
kaisa_1_scene_160_text: speaker_akali: Yeah, I bet. Staying home and looking after a bunch of weird pets sounds way cooler than seeing history come alive at the world’s only matcha museum.
kaisa_1_scene_180_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, one of us has to be responsible…
kaisa_1_scene_190_text: speaker_akali: Spare me the self-sacrificing monologue, Kai. Sorry, Captain Kai, of the Star Guardians. Bwahaha!
kaisa_1_scene_200_text: speaker_akali: See you in a week! Later, skater.
kaisa_1_scene_210_text: speaker_akali: Oh, and Umi… don’t go too hard on her. Heh.
kaisa_1_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: She’ll be back, Umi.
kaisa_1_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: No, no! You need to stay behind, with me!
kaisa_1_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s right, Ina. We’re gonna have a lot of fun.
kaisa_1_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, yeah, you’re used to doing fun things with Akali.
kaisa_1_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: But maybe my definition of fun is just different! Did you ever consider that?
kaisa_1_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, I’m not really taking suggestions for activities, and—
kaisa_1_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s not in our budget, Waku! Dad has me on a very strict allowance!
kaisa_1_scene_350_text: speaker_chiizu: Please, everyone! Give Miss Kai’Sa some space.
kaisa_1_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: Thanks, Chiizu. You know, you’re the only one that—

kaisa_1_scene_370_text: speaker_chiizu: Though, now that I have a moment… I was wondering if perhaps we’d have some free time to go to a concert. There’s a great singer in town, and I thought we might float by.
kaisa_1_scene_400_text: speaker_chiizu: OH, NO! I spoke out of turn, didn’t I? I’M SO SORRY!
kaisa_1_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: I know our friends are off having fun, exploring a cool city, enjoying delicious food…
kaisa_1_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Umi! Jeez, for a manta ray you sure act like an evil empress. Okay, I’ll get to the point—
kaisa_1_scene_460_text: speaker_kaisa: We have work to do.
kaisa_1_scene_470_text: speaker_chiizu: Miss Kai’Sa, I don’t really know anything about high-school physics. I’m a soulful being with the heart of a poet.
kaisa_1_scene_480_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not talking about homework.
kaisa_1_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m talking about being the best Star Guardians we can be!
kaisa_1_scene_500_text: speaker_chiizu: Oh—well, we aren’t really guardians, per se…
kaisa_1_scene_520_text: speaker_chiizu: Yes! That’s right, Waku. We are simply adorable companions meant to distract and delight.
kaisa_1_scene_530_text: speaker_chiizu: We aren’t meant to see… combat.
kaisa_1_scene_550_text: speaker_chiizu: Okay, some of us aren’t meant to see combat. Unless we’re transforming weapons, sentient guns-slash-knives, or we explode when thrown.
kaisa_1_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, times have changed, Chiizu.
kaisa_1_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: When the rest of the guardians come back, we’ll show them that practice makes—
kaisa_1_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: No… perfect, not paninis. But I appreciate the enthusiasm.
kaisa_1_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: We can get paninis later.
kaisa_1_scene_620_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re gonna have to be my right-hand… rabbit this week.
kaisa_1_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: You up to the challenge?
kaisa_1_scene_650_text: speaker_kaisa: I can’t offer you a salary.
kaisa_1_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: You’ll do it anyway? Great.
kaisa_1_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: Ina, wait! I didn’t tell you what I need help with… Stars alive, why are there so many of you?
kaisa_1_scene_710_text: speaker_kaisa: Hmm. Okay… we can spar on Sunday, run some drills after school on Monday…
kaisa_1_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: Then, Tuesday, I have journalism club…
kaisa_1_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: What, Chiizu?! What is so important?!
kaisa_1_scene_780_text: speaker_chiizu: Umi flew off. They’re missing.
kaisa_1_scene_820_text: speaker_chiizu: Because you look mad.
kaisa_1_scene_170a_10_text: speaker_akali: Who said anything about following the class itinerary?
kaisa_1_scene_170a_20_text: speaker_akali: I need a vacation.
kaisa_1_scene_170a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: [Yeah… I could use one, too.]
kaisa_1_scene_170b_10_text: speaker_akali: Wish I was. I love to joke.
kaisa_1_scene_170b_20_text: speaker_akali: But I’ve never been more serious.
kaisa_1_scene_170b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: You’ll take lots of photos, right?
kaisa_1_scene_170b_40_text: speaker_akali: Of course! But I don’t think they let us take ‘em during the tasting tour.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Uh… I was gonna hang out with some friends from school.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_30_text: speaker_akali: We’re your friends from school. Try again.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: …Go to the hot springs and have a spa day?
kaisa_1_scene_170c_50_text: speaker_akali: You? Relax?! Good one.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_60_text: speaker_kaisa: [Sigh] …I was going to catch up on homework.
kaisa_1_scene_170c_70_text: speaker_akali: Yep, there’s the ugly truth.
taliyah_1_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Taliyah? Did anyone see where Taliyah went?
taliyah_1_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Taliyah? Hey, are you around here?
taliyah_1_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: Tali! There you are! I’ve been looking all over for you.
taliyah_1_scene_70_text: speaker_taliyah: Oh! Captain! I apologize. I didn’t mean to cause you any distress.
taliyah_1_scene_80_text: speaker_taliyah: What can I help you with? Hopefully nothing too troubling.
taliyah_1_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: You, uh… left your familiar in class…
taliyah_1_scene_120_text: speaker_taliyah: Aru! You silly little thing. Captain, I apologize profusely for Aru’s behavior. Sometimes, they… wander off. I can assure you this won’t happen again.
taliyah_1_scene_140_text: speaker_taliyah: I know nobody can see them, but… if you’d like me to run extra training drills as punishment, I fully support your decision!
taliyah_1_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: Um… That… won’t be necessary…
taliyah_1_scene_170_text: speaker_taliyah: Yes? Is there anything else, Captain?
taliyah_1_scene_180_text: speaker_kaisa: Nothing, I just… You’re so… different when we’re training… almost like an entirely other person.
taliyah_1_scene_190_text: speaker_taliyah: Ah, yes, well...! It’s, ah… That is true…
taliyah_1_scene_200_text: speaker_taliyah: I… er… Well… it’s just that… um…
taliyah_1_scene_210_text: speaker_kaisa: I-I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to embarrass you! I, uh… Oh, gosh, how do I fix this?
taliyah_1_scene_220_text: speaker_taliyah: N-no worries! I just think I’d rather tell you… away from school. School is kind of… a related problem.
taliyah_1_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: Got it! In that case…
taliyah_1_scene_250_text: speaker_taliyah: Don’t worry, it’s not that awkward. You just have to… lean into the fantasy.
taliyah_1_scene_260_text: speaker_taliyah: You go on ahead, Captain! I need to get changed before I meet you.
taliyah_1_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait. What do you mean, “get changed”...?
taliyah_1_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: What is this menu? “Cutie Puffs with an Extra Special Smooch, Just For You?” “Cutie Coffee with a Dollop of Clouds?”
taliyah_1_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, no! All the items have little characters. “Café Cuties Vladimir offers you a cup of his finest tea, but watch out for his evil nephew…”
taliyah_1_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: The cute little tea guy has an evil nephew? Is… is there an expanded Café Cuties universe? There’s, like, fifteen characters! What is happening?!
taliyah_1_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: Maybe I died on the walk over. Maybe I’m trapped here. I sinned in life, and Café Cuties is my purgatory.
taliyah_1_scene_330_text: speaker_taliyah: Hey, be nice! I really like this place!
taliyah_1_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: Tali! I’m so glad you’re here! This pla… ce…
taliyah_1_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: Isn’t what I… expected…
taliyah_1_scene_370_text: speaker_taliyah: …Hmm? Is there something on my face?
taliyah_1_scene_380_text: speaker_taliyah: Hang on… Okay, did I wipe it off? Captain? Did I get it?
taliyah_1_scene_240a_10_text: speaker_taliyah: Ah… I don’t know if I should go to Arcade World…
taliyah_1_scene_240a_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Too loud? Sorry, I didn’t mean to…
taliyah_1_scene_240a_30_text: speaker_taliyah: Oh, it’s not that. I can get a little… uh… competitive. One time, I told this kid I’d bury his family. It’s… not a great look.
taliyah_1_scene_240a_40_text: speaker_taliyah: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!
taliyah_1_scene_240b_10_text: speaker_taliyah: Ah… Targon Park? I know the wishing tree is in bloom, but, uh…
taliyah_1_scene_240b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Not a fan of wishes? Or trees?
taliyah_1_scene_240b_30_text: speaker_taliyah: No! I mean, yes! I mean… Um, maybe not somewhere outside… At least, not right this minute…
taliyah_1_scene_240b_40_text: speaker_taliyah: What about Café Cuties? They have really cute drinks, and everyone there is super nice!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_10_text: speaker_taliyah: Ahhh, Café Cuties… I’m one stamp away from winning a special meep teacup. It has little eyes! It looks at me!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Meep… teacup? I’m not familiar… Café Cuties isn’t exactly my kind of…
taliyah_1_scene_240c_30_text: speaker_taliyah: It’s decided! Café Cuties it is!
taliyah_1_scene_240c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, man… a maid café? This is gonna be so awkward…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: Tell me, what would you do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: You saved the world, right? I saw you do it. Come on, tell me something!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Lux… Please… What should I do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh… I’m talking to a statue. And to myself.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: It felt like we were finally safe, like you made everything… safe. That’s why I wanted to be like you. But…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_70_text: speaker_morgana: Hello, class. I come bearing some truly tragic news.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_80_text: speaker_morgana: Your former instructor… Mr. Puboe? He’s met with a very unfortunate accident during the shocking incident downtown. I’m afraid he won’t be returning.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_90_text: speaker_morgana: Thankfully, I was willing to step in to help shape your young minds. Though I’m new to the profession, I’m sure we’ll all learn to see eye to eye.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_100_text: speaker_morgana: Some of us… more than others, I suspect. Hmhmhm.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_110_text: speaker_morgana: Despite the circumstances… I think we’re going to have a wonderful year together.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: We can’t transform at school. We can’t reveal our identities…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: We can’t do anything! How do you fight a monster that’s hiding in plain sight?! I just want to protect everyone!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: This city looks up to you. They remember the old guardians. I want to… No, I have to be a Star Guardian the way you were. A leader.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: Lux… Tell me… What do I do?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_160_text: speaker_akali: Talking to the statue again, huh?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: Hm? That’s weird… My phone’s going off.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_200_text: speaker_akali: Why’s that weird? Ekko is always texting about machine stuff. Or maybe Taliyah “found another rock”.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_210_text: speaker_akali: Or… oof, I hope it’s not a giant wall of text from Sona. I love her, but… please… my one brain cell…

chapter_2_act_1_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: [“Nice work handling those creatures. Now that we know you can handle yourselves, we should discuss a… mutual problem. Meet us outside the city, alone.”]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: [“And don’t keep us waiting! You know how I get when I’m BORED!”]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: [Hm… Must be that monster again… Fiddlesticks. I won’t let it hurt Akali, or the team.]
chapter_2_act_1_scene_250_text: speaker_akali: Kai? You’re getting quiet again.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_260_text: speaker_akali: It’s a Sona text, isn’t it? How long? Two paragraphs?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m so sorry, but I have to go. This is…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: …I just have to go.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_300_text: speaker_akali: Wait, what’s wrong?! Kai?! Kai!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_310_text: speaker_akali: Hmph. Think you can avoid me? Best-friend-following ninja-jutsu, activate!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_330_text: speaker_akali: Don’t judge me, Lux statue. I’m leaning into it.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: …Guh… Alright… huff… This is the spot.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: …At least, I think it is. Exact coordinates would have been nice.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: …Huff… ugh… Flying is… so much easier…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_380_text: speaker_unknown: I concur. It’s one of our more useful powers.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: Show yourself, monster! I’m not in the mood for games!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_410_text: speaker_unknown: Tee-hee! She thinks WE’RE the monster! That’s a fun game. I wanna play THAT one!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_420_text: speaker_unknown: This isn’t another chance for you to destroy the city. You know what we’re here for.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_430_text: speaker_unknown: Oh, BOO! I just want to have FUN!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_440_text: speaker_kaisa: No way… That’s impossible…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_450_text: speaker_unknown: Oh, it’s VERY possible!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_460_text: speaker_syndra: Don’t act so surprised. This is not the first time we’ve met.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_470_text: speaker_zoe: Oh, boy! A widdle baby STAR GUARDIAN! Can I peel off her skin? CAN I?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_480_text: speaker_zoe: OooooOOOooooo, wait! She recognizes me! Was it something I did? Was it someone I KILLED?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_490_text: speaker_syndra: Silence. You’ve spoken enough, Twilight Star. Empty threats accomplish nothing… and we don’t have much time.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_500_text: speaker_kaisa: Wh… what are you two doing together?! Syndra, you’re a Star Guardian! And that’s...!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_520_text: speaker_syndra: Or at least, she was one. Though that was many lifetimes ago.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_530_text: speaker_zoe: Now, I have lots of fun DISINTEGRATING my friends! That’s YOU, widdle guardian!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_540_text: speaker_kaisa: No… I saw Rakan destroy you! The guardians beat you!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: The entire city watched you die!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_560_text: speaker_zoe: Awww, are your expectations crushed? Do you need a hug and some sparkles to get over it? Well, TOO BAD!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_570_text: speaker_zoe: You can’t kill chaos, silly! But that Rakan boy really did put the hurt on me, YEOWCH!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_580_text: speaker_zoe: It took me AGES to find this world again! And by then, all the guardians I wanted to kill were loooong gone!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_590_text: speaker_zoe: …Except for this one. Yuck.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_600_text: speaker_syndra: The feeling is mutual.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_620_text: speaker_syndra: We’ve come for Fiddlesticks.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: …The checkerboard monster with the awful voice? That’s who you want?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_640_text: speaker_zoe: It was CHESS! SHE LOVED CHESS!

chapter_2_act_1_scene_680_text: speaker_syndra: Fiddlesticks is more powerful than any foe I have ever faced. It has existed since the days of the very first Star Guardians… and has hunted us all from the shadows.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_700_text: speaker_syndra: Zoe, myself, and our companions. The original Star Guardians chosen by the First Star. Back before the costs of our oaths were made clear.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_710_text: speaker_zoe: We’re gonna SMASH that monster for what it did! I’M GONNA RIP OFF ITS STUPID HEAD!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_720_text: speaker_syndra: It has grown far too powerful with victims and time. While we are strong, we cannot stop it alone.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_730_text: speaker_syndra: Prepare yourself and your team. If we strike together, maybe we stand a chance.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_760_text: speaker_kaisa: …Alright. I’ll get them ready.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_770_text: speaker_kaisa: But what happens after this? What about… her?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_780_text: speaker_zoe: HMPH! It’s rude to point!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_790_text: speaker_syndra: We’ll cross that bridge if we survive. Until then…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_800_text: speaker_syndra: …Take care, guardian. The battle ahead may be our last.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_10_text: speaker_akali: You know… I’m around if you want to talk.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I… I don’t want you to hear this stuff. These thoughts stay with me.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180a_30_text: speaker_akali: We weren’t always Star Guardians, Kai… We were friends first.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_10_text: speaker_akali: It’s alright, Kai. I’m not going to make fun of you or anything.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_20_text: speaker_akali: You know, you don't have to talk to a statue. I’m always here if you need me.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: …Thanks, Kali. You know I don’t like asking for help. If I focus on leading the group…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180b_40_text: speaker_akali: Well, don’t forget I’m here, okay? I’m not a statue, but you know.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_10_text: speaker_akali: Oho, look at you! So fancy with your big-city therapist!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: You also live in the city!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_30_text: speaker_akali: True, but if I needed to talk about my problems on a budget, maybe I’d go to… I dunno… my best friend?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_180c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Akali, we’ve talked about this. Leading the guardians is…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_10_text: speaker_syndra: As I mentioned, we have a mutual problem.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_30_text: speaker_syndra: Morgana? Interesting… So, she’s already here…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_40_text: speaker_zoe: Ooooh, one of your stupid new playmates, Syndra?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610a_50_text: speaker_syndra: In a certain light. Though I’ve never been very fond of her. Deal with Morgana as you will, young guardian. She is not why we’ve contacted you.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_10_text: speaker_zoe: Ohohoho! Syndra, how COULD you!? The guardians! The First Star! Friendship and love and cookies!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_30_text: speaker_syndra: You are pursuing an ideal you don’t fully understand, girl. Do you think Lux was the first to take the oath? Or Ahri? Or Xayah?
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_40_text: speaker_syndra: The First Star’s power comes at a terrible cost. In the end, it takes the only thing that matters… and that is why we’re here.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610b_50_text: speaker_zoe: Looks like we’re gonna be PALS, widdle baby guardian!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_10_text: speaker_syndra: That’s right… You witnessed the invasion.
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: The Battle of the Twilight Star… So many people… my friends…
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_30_text: speaker_zoe: Uh-oh! Do we have some UNEXAMINED TRAUMA on our hands?! Oooh, I LOVE trauma!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_40_text: speaker_zoe: Did they SCREAM when they died… or were they lucky enough to get BOPPED on the head by a falling star?!
chapter_2_act_1_scene_610c_50_text: speaker_zoe: …YOU won’t forgive ME?! You don’t know ANYTHING! You humans live for a hundred years, and then, you’re GONE! You can’t imagine...! You can’t!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_30_text: speaker_zoe: Back when this happened?!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_40_text: speaker_zoe: I had so much fun! All those people, gone forever! And you were right in the middle of it!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_50_text: speaker_zoe: What’s wrong? You don’t want to remember!? Well, too bad!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_60_text: speaker_zoe: You couldn’t do anything to save the city then! And you can’t do anything now!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_70_text: speaker_zoe: I see you, Kai’Sa! You can never hide from me!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_80_text: speaker_zoe: I SEE YOU, KAI’SA! KAI’SA!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_90_text: speaker_unknown: Kai’Sa? Kai’Sa! Stop daydreaming, we’re trying to train!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh… sorry, I forgot where I was for a second.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_110_text: speaker_akali: Forgot!? You made us come out here, Kai! This isn’t exactly where I want to be on the last day of spring vacation!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_120_text: speaker_akali: I thought I would spend every day at the arcade…! So cruel.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_130_text: speaker_akali: Pff, whatever. Nothing’s attacked this city since we took the oath.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_140_text: speaker_akali: Which is fine by me, thanks for asking. I’d rather not relive last year!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_150_text: speaker_ekko: It’s better to be prepared, ‘Kali. Plus I can test out my powers on old stop signs.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: More testing, huh? Is that what you do when you skip training?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_170_text: speaker_ekko: Hm. I’m sure I have no idea what you’re talking about… captain.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_190_text: speaker_chiizu: Sona says you can do it, Ekko! Believe in yourself!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_210_text: speaker_chiizu: Ahhh! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to editorialize!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: Heh. This team’s lively as ever.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_230_text: speaker_chiizu: She’s gone mad with rage! Every mouse for themselves!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_240_text: speaker_ekko: Sona! You’re not supposed to hit your familiar like that! You have to go for their center of mass!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: One day, that mouse is really gonna get it.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_270_text: speaker_taliyah: Captain! I’m pumped from training and can’t wait to sock a big monster right in its monster face!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: Good to hear, Taliyah. By the way… you act really differently when you wear that uniform. It’s refreshing.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_290_text: speaker_taliyah: Thanks! I feel more like myself in the outfit.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_300_text: speaker_taliyah: Star power! Chu chu!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_310_text: speaker_akali: Hey, Tali. Sona’s about to fight her own mouse.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_320_text: speaker_taliyah: What?! The battle of the titans is happening?! Two enter, one leaves?! Oh, I can’t miss this!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_340_text: speaker_akali: …You’re sure you’re okay, Kai? You looked kinda pale for a minute. Need to talk?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_360_text: speaker_akali: Actually, Kai… I did want to ask you something…
chapter_1_act_1_scene_370_text: speaker_akali: Now that people know about the guardians… or, the old ones—not us, obviously, since we haven’t done anything yet…
chapter_1_act_1_scene_380_text: speaker_akali: How long before this all ends? All of us, out here, having fun together?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_390_text: speaker_akali: What if Zoe comes back? Or something even worse? What happened to the other guardians won’t happen to us… will it?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_400_text: speaker_taliyah: Uh-oh, the sun’s starting to go down! Get back up there, sun!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_410_text: speaker_taliyah: Team? The sun isn’t listening to me. Should we call it?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_420_text: speaker_ekko: Seems like the right move. I have to get back to my… uh… Well, I gotta get back.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_430_text: speaker_ekko: Hey, Sona. And Sona’s mouse… thing. What do you think? Training over?
chapter_1_act_1_scene_450_text: speaker_chiizu: She says she’ll race you down the hill! And that you know what my name is!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_470_text: speaker_chiizu: …What? OH, NO! IS THAT NOT WHAT YOU SAID?!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_480_text: speaker_chiizu: MISS SONA, PLEASE! I’M A FACET OF YOUR SUBCONSCIOUS! MISS SONA! AAAAHHHHH!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_490_text: speaker_taliyah: Hey, no fair! That’s a huge head start!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_520_text: speaker_akali: Aren’t you all the same age?

chapter_1_act_1_scene_530_text: speaker_ekko: It’s a mindset, ‘Kali. That’s why I’m the genius inventor, and they’re all a bunch of goofy kids. As out of touch second years, I don’t expect you to understand.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_540_text: speaker_akali: Yesterday, you spent a hundred dollars entering a fighting game tournament and got last place.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_550_text: speaker_ekko: Wow! Wow! I do not recall that experience!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_560_text: speaker_ekko: I’m so offended that I need to leave this discussion immediately. Bye!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_580_text: speaker_akali: Pff, the second I showed him up...
chapter_1_act_1_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: At least they’re punctual about something. Come on. We should head out too. I don’t want to run into those middle-aged joggers again.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_600_text: speaker_akali: Ugh, good call. Their wraparound sunglasses are… not attractive.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_610_text: speaker_akali: Anyway, Kai… I didn’t get to finish my thought.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_620_text: speaker_akali: …Do you really think monsters will attack the city again? We haven’t seen any in… well, since the Battle of the Twilight Star.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_650_text: speaker_kaisa: Sigh… I wish the old guardians would come back. They would know what to do.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: Hey, it’s alright! Whatever happens, we have each other! Star Guardians stick together. That’s our whole thing.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_680_text: speaker_akali: Yeah, I know. I know! Guardians forever, best friends for life.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: Best friends for life!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_700_text: speaker_kaisa: And nothing will ever change that. Not monsters, not being Star Guardians, nothing. No matter what.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350a_20_text: speaker_akali: Well, no use worrying about it then!
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350a_30_text: speaker_akali: If you wanna talk about it later, though… All you have to do is ask. I’m always here for you.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350b_20_text: speaker_akali: It’s tough. We’re all still… processing. Kind of crazy how fast they rebuilt the damaged parts of the city, though.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Sometimes, I remember all those people, and… Ugh, well, you know. You were there, too.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350c_10_text: speaker_akali: How big is the robot? If it’s a really big robot, the robot wins. If it’s a slightly smaller robot… 50/50.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_350c_20_text: speaker_akali: Or… Hmm… In that mecha show, the big train robot beat up a dinosaur. Can you beat up a dinosaur? I’m not so sure.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640a_10_text: speaker_kaisa: I wish I had a better answer.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640a_20_text: speaker_kaisa: If they do… we just have to be ready.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640b_10_text: speaker_kaisa: Just assume we’ll have to fight at some point, Kali.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: If we’re lucky, it’ll be against some small fry.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640c_10_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m very serious about this.
chapter_1_act_1_scene_640c_20_text: speaker_akali: Hey, come on. Stop joking around.
tutorial_scene_10_text: speaker_unknown: W-what is that?! That girl… Is she some kind of monster?!
tutorial_scene_20_text: speaker_unknown: That’s… That’s the Twilight Star! She’s going to destroy the entire city! W-what do we do?!
tutorial_scene_30_text: speaker_unknown: Wait… Who are those…?
tutorial_scene_40_text: speaker_unknown: Are those people fighting her?
tutorial_scene_50_text: speaker_unknown: Are they… trying to save us…? They’re… incredible!
tutorial_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: That vision again… Why is it happening so often, lately?
tutorial_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: …Ah, no sense dwelling on it now.
tutorial_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh, so loud! Ina, why?!
tutorial_scene_110_text: speaker_ina: […Oh, you’re awake! Perfect! Remember, there are only a few weeks left before the school year starts.]
tutorial_scene_130_text: speaker_ina: [I will absolutely remind you, bunny! We still have to finish your Star Guardian training!]
tutorial_scene_140_text: speaker_ina: [Only a few lessons left to go before you're ready to protect the universe! Yay!]
tutorial_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: So loud… So early… Ina, please…
tutorial_scene_160_text: speaker_ina: [“Ina, please start my training right now?” Sure thing, bunny! Let’s begin with some trivia.]
tutorial_scene_170_text: speaker_kaisa: Fine. I… guess some morning training couldn’t hurt.
tutorial_scene_180_text: speaker_ina: [Perfect! Choose the response you think fits best, and I’ll respond in kind. Don’t worry, there are no wrong answers! Be yourself!]
tutorial_scene_190_text: speaker_ina: [What is the job of a Star Guardian?]
tutorial_scene_210_text: speaker_kaisa: Right, I think I’ve got it.
tutorial_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: What’s next? Can we move to combat training?
tutorial_scene_230_text: speaker_ina: [You sure do like fighting! But first, let's talk about navigation. Being a strong fighter is useless if you can’t get to the battle in time!]
tutorial_scene_240_text: speaker_ina: [Your star phone has a special interface, updated by yours truly. Let's take a look now.]
tutorial_scene_200a_20_text: speaker_ina: [Although… it's been a while since anything bad happened.]
tutorial_scene_200a_30_text: speaker_ina: [But that’s no reason to start slacking off!]
tutorial_scene_200b_20_text: speaker_ina: [Your friends are your greatest strength! Well, besides the First Star.]
tutorial_scene_200b_30_text: speaker_ina: [So treat them all well, and keep them safe!]
tutorial_scene_200c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Yawn… back to bed…
tutorial_scene_200c_30_text: speaker_ina: [Y-you can’t do that! It’s against the rules! Hey, wake up! Hey! HEY!!!]
tutorial_scene_200c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m kidding, Ina. Jeez, stop yelling.
tutorial_scene_200c_50_text: speaker_ina: [Sorry, bunny! I’m naturally very loud!]
ekko_2_scene_10_text: speaker_ekko: Inventor’s Log: After a few setbacks, I’m prepared to proceed with ChronoDisplacer Test 91.
ekko_2_scene_20_text: speaker_ekko: Recalibrated the internal zeptometer for more accurate retrieval to the millisecond.
ekko_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: [It’s been a few weeks since I followed Ekko home…]
ekko_2_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [He was mad at first when he found out. But then he seemed to forget about it…]
ekko_2_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: [And now, out of the blue, he invites me over. What’s he playing at?]
ekko_2_scene_60_text: speaker_ekko: Kai’Sa! You’re just in time!
ekko_2_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: Just in time for what exactly?
ekko_2_scene_80_text: speaker_ekko: To witness the first successful test of my ChronoDisplacer!
ekko_2_scene_110_text: speaker_ekko: The title is a work in progress.
ekko_2_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: So, this is the “project” you’ve been working on?
ekko_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: The one that’s been keeping you from coming to training?
ekko_2_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: And the reason you missed Mandatory Mochi Monday?
ekko_2_scene_150_text: speaker_ekko: Yeah, sorry I’ve been slacking on my Star Guardian duties… though uh, nobody likes the mandatory Mondays. Just an FYI.
ekko_2_scene_160_text: speaker_ekko: But once I get this working, I’ll be back full time. I promise.
ekko_2_scene_170_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh… fine. So what exactly does this thing do?
ekko_2_scene_180_text: speaker_ekko: Oh… uh, yeah, I should explain.
ekko_2_scene_190_text: speaker_ekko: When I became a Star Guardian, the First Light gave me the power to go back in time...
ekko_2_scene_200_text: speaker_kaisa: I remember, Ekko. I was there.
ekko_2_scene_210_text: speaker_ekko: Oh yeah! I’ll, uh… skip ahead.
ekko_2_scene_220_text: speaker_ekko: I’ve been experimenting... looking for a way to amplify my abilities.
ekko_2_scene_230_text: speaker_ekko: I want to increase the distance I can travel backward. The longer the better.
ekko_2_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: Where are you trying to go?
ekko_2_scene_270_text: speaker_ekko: Normally, I can only travel back as far as three minutes.
ekko_2_scene_280_text: speaker_ekko: But with the help of this machine, I should be able to travel as far back as three years!
ekko_2_scene_300_text: speaker_ekko: …Why aren’t you excited about it?
ekko_2_scene_310_text: speaker_ekko: Just think of the possibilities!
ekko_2_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: I thought you said you couldn’t change the past. And why would you even…?
ekko_2_scene_330_text: speaker_ekko: I just wasn’t thinking hard enough.
ekko_2_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: …Wait. Didn’t this neighborhood get hit during the invasion…? The night Zoe attacked…
ekko_2_scene_350_text: speaker_ekko: I know I can do it. I know I can go back. I just need to figure out a few more things…
ekko_2_scene_370_text: speaker_ekko: Just have to get there one minute sooner… Even a moment…
ekko_2_scene_390_text: speaker_ekko: I’m stronger now. I’m ready.
ekko_2_scene_410_text: speaker_kaisa: You can talk to me, okay? That’s why you asked me to come here, right? To open up, and get this off your chest?
ekko_2_scene_430_text: speaker_ekko: Whatever singalongs you’re doing with the rest of the team, that ain’t me. Nice try, though.
ekko_2_scene_440_text: speaker_ekko: I just need someone to help me operate the machine.
ekko_2_scene_460_text: speaker_ekko: …I suppose I do owe you an explanation.
ekko_2_scene_470_text: speaker_ekko: I was out at the arcade with my friend…
ekko_2_scene_480_text: speaker_ekko: When Zoe attacked the city.
ekko_2_scene_490_text: speaker_ekko: …! What’s happening?! Is that… some sort of monster?
ekko_2_scene_510_text: speaker_ekko: I thought he was warning me. But when I turned around, I saw him under the rubble.
ekko_2_scene_520_text: speaker_ekko: He came out of his coma, but… the doctors still aren’t sure if he’ll walk again.
ekko_2_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: So… you think you can save him if you go back to that night.
ekko_2_scene_540_text: speaker_ekko: If I can get there before. If I can warn him…
ekko_2_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: You know, sometimes the past—
ekko_2_scene_560_text: speaker_ekko: I’m doing this, Captain. Either you can help me, or you can leave.

ekko_2_scene_570_text: speaker_ekko: I don’t care about when or where we’re “allowed” to use our powers, or how they’re supposed to be used, or whatever dumb rules you come up with. This is my choice.
ekko_2_scene_580_text: speaker_kaisa: Ekko, I’m only… Okay. I’ll do it. Let’s change the past.
ekko_2_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: How do we get this thing going?
ekko_2_scene_450a_10_text: speaker_ekko: Uh… it’s a little bit more complicated than that.
ekko_2_scene_450a_20_text: speaker_ekko: What do you know about relativity?
ekko_2_scene_450a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Whatever we learned in school.
ekko_2_scene_450a_40_text: speaker_ekko: We haven’t had a lecture on relativity this year.
ekko_2_scene_450a_50_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, okay. Then nothing.
ekko_2_scene_450a_60_text: speaker_kaisa: Just like I know nothing about what you have planned.
ekko_2_scene_450b_10_text: speaker_ekko: You don’t want me doing something dangerous alone, do you?
ekko_2_scene_450b_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, come on… This is emotional manipulation!
ekko_2_scene_450c_10_text: speaker_ekko: I won’t tell if you won’t.
ekko_2_scene_450c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: We could hurt someone…
ekko_2_scene_450c_30_text: speaker_ekko: We won’t. If it works, no one is going to get hurt.
ekko_2_scene_450c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: …Hm. Alright, what do you have planned?
kaisa_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I don’t think Umi is around here, Ina.
kaisa_2_scene_40_text: speaker_chiizu: Oh, dear. OH, DEAR! We’re going to be in so much trouble.
kaisa_2_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: We’ll find Umi. They can’t have gone far.
kaisa_2_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: They wouldn’t have gone into the sewer, Waku.
kaisa_2_scene_90_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, no, obviously! I’ll go in the sewer! In the sewer with all the sewage! Let me check right now!
kaisa_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: Don’t say that. Umi is out there somewhere.
kaisa_2_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: …We’ll search all of Valoran City if we have to.
kaisa_2_scene_150_text: speaker_chiizu: Great idea, Miss Kai’Sa! I know just where to start!
kaisa_2_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: …The school? Your great idea is… the school?
kaisa_2_scene_170_text: speaker_kaisa: Why, Chiizu? Why would Umi come here?
kaisa_2_scene_180_text: speaker_chiizu: To learn, of course!
kaisa_2_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: The entire school is on a field trip.
kaisa_2_scene_200_text: speaker_chiizu: NOOOO! I’ve led the team astray!
kaisa_2_scene_210_text: speaker_chiizu: I’m a terrible Star Guardian!!! Or adorable Star Guardian familiar! I don’t remember where we landed on that.
kaisa_2_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: What do you mean Chiizu just needs some time to cool off? Cool off from what? He looks like a cartoon mouse!
kaisa_2_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, mother of… Yeah, alright, Waku. I’ll give him some space.
kaisa_2_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Huh… Well, there’s probably a better chance Umi would go there than school…
kaisa_2_scene_280_text: speaker_chiizu: YOU’RE RIGHT! IT WAS AN AWFUL IDEA! I’M SO, SO SORRY!
kaisa_2_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: No sign of Umi.

kaisa_2_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not going back up there to get you a “Special Cutie Surprise Special Menu Doughnut with Bonus Smooch.” That’s… I can’t even begin to describe how embarrassing that is.
kaisa_2_scene_330_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait a minute… Can you even eat food?
kaisa_2_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s what I thought! You just want the Bonus Smooch! Which is probably just a sticker or something!
kaisa_2_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: Now isn’t the time for games, Aru.
kaisa_2_scene_390_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh! You think Umi’s at Arcade World?
kaisa_2_scene_410_text: speaker_kaisa: That makes sense! Akali loves that place, too…
kaisa_2_scene_420_text: speaker_kaisa: She’s always going on about how school is a prison and the arcade is where she does all her real learning.
kaisa_2_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: …Which would explain why she’s getting straight Cs.
kaisa_2_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Sure, now I’m boring. Well, lead the way!
kaisa_2_scene_460_text: speaker_kaisa: Umi’s not by the VALORANT machine…
kaisa_2_scene_480_text: speaker_kaisa: Not by the snacks either?
kaisa_2_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: Well then. They definitely aren’t here.
kaisa_2_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: Maybe we should just call it for today. Look again tomorrow?
kaisa_2_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: Hey! That’s my line. I’m the one who says, “We should never give up.” Unless we should give up… you know, for tactical reasons.
kaisa_2_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: Noodle Bill’s! It’s so obvious! How did I not think of that?
kaisa_2_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course I’m attentive to my team’s needs! It’s just, sometimes, I get so focused on Star Guardian work that I—
kaisa_2_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not making excuses. I…
kaisa_2_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: …W-we should get going! We’re coming for you, Umi!
kaisa_2_scene_620_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Well, well, Miss Kai’Sa! I think I know why you’re here…
kaisa_2_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: Really? You’ve seen a floating… uh… manta ray… thing?
kaisa_2_scene_650_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I thought you were here to eat ramen…
kaisa_2_scene_660_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Ha! The look on your face!
kaisa_2_scene_670_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Yeah, I’ve seen your pet…
kaisa_2_scene_680_text: speaker_noodle_bill: …And I see you’ve brought more of them. A lot more. An entire little zoo.
kaisa_2_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: These things? Uh… yes. They’re my pets!
kaisa_2_scene_710_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Quite… uh… exotic animals.
kaisa_2_scene_720_text: speaker_noodle_bill: And very talkative, too… This one in particular.
kaisa_2_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: Umi! There you are! I’ve looked so many places for you! Places so far apart from one another! On foot!
kaisa_2_scene_740_text: speaker_kaisa: Sorry to bother you, Bill. We’ll get going now.
kaisa_2_scene_750_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Why not stay a while, Kai’Sa? I think you could use a break.
kaisa_2_scene_770_text: speaker_kaisa: Ah… that aroma… The Targon Park bicentennial special tonkotsu… but they only make it once a year...!
kaisa_2_scene_780_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I wrote that recipe, so really, it’s whenever I decide to make it. Gotta break the rules sometimes if you wanna live long! Wahaha!
kaisa_2_scene_760a_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I’m sure you’ve been running around all day looking for your lost… pet.
kaisa_2_scene_760a_30_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You know what they say… “Before you take care of others, you must take care of yourself.” I came up with that, by the way. Trade secret.
kaisa_2_scene_760b_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: One tonkotsu, coming right up!
kaisa_2_scene_760b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: You wouldn’t believe the day I had…
kaisa_2_scene_760b_30_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I’m sure you’re exhausted. You always put so much on your plate!
kaisa_2_scene_760b_40_text: speaker_noodle_bill: The only thing on one’s plate that matters… is good food.
kaisa_2_scene_760c_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Training? For what? Normal stuff, I’m sure, but hey, let’s talk about it.
kaisa_2_scene_760c_30_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Hrm, a competition. You make your pets work as hard as you do!
kaisa_2_scene_760c_40_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Relax, Kai’Sa. If not for yourself… for them.
taliyah_2_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: You think you can take me down?! Not today, First Year!
taliyah_2_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m the captain for a reason, Tali! And you just let your guard down!
taliyah_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: A rookie mistake, one I’ll make you pay for! Rain of Starlight!
taliyah_2_scene_60_text: speaker_taliyah: I let my guard down, huh?! More like you’re the captain of sucking, ha!
taliyah_2_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: This… This isn’t over!
taliyah_2_scene_80_text: speaker_taliyah: I think it is! You just used all your energy for your special attack, while I’ve been dodging everything you throw at me!
taliyah_2_scene_90_text: speaker_kaisa: No way...! I can still...!
taliyah_2_scene_100_text: speaker_taliyah: Nice speech, Captain. Now, get ready to ride the pain train!
taliyah_2_scene_110_text: speaker_taliyah: Chu chu! Star Volley!
taliyah_2_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: I’ll get you for thiiiiiiiis!
taliyah_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: Ow, ow… Can someone help me drink my Macha-Kun Lovely Latte? Or give me my Special Smooch Just For Me? I’m in quite a lot of pain…
taliyah_2_scene_140_text: speaker_taliyah: I-I’m so sorry, Captain! I truly didn’t mean to hit you so hard!
taliyah_2_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: Ouch… ugh… It’s totally fine… Good to see you’re… ow, ow, ow… taking to the training…
taliyah_2_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Whew, you weren’t kidding about the pain train. That really smarts.
taliyah_2_scene_170_text: speaker_taliyah: Also… I think the special smooch is just a sticker.
taliyah_2_scene_180_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh… Foiled again… Just like Viego trying to get to his uncle Vladimir’s exotic teas…
taliyah_2_scene_200_text: speaker_taliyah: Soooo, I guess you like this place now, huh?
taliyah_2_scene_210_text: speaker_kaisa: It grows on you.

taliyah_2_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: Also, they did Café Cuties Viego dirty! Sealing him in a prison of crystal tea?! All he wanted was to use the power of the hibiscus fragments to free his wife from the clutches of Earl Grey!
taliyah_2_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: Ahem. I’m not fangirling. I’m just… passionate about tea. Let’s change the subject.

taliyah_2_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: What happens to you out in the field, Tali? At school, you avoid almost everyone, and you’re super polite… Here, you’re, well… It looks like you work on a crabbing ship.
taliyah_2_scene_250_text: speaker_taliyah: Haha… Yeah, I guess it’s a little confusing.
taliyah_2_scene_260_text: speaker_taliyah: Truth be told… It's the school uniforms.
taliyah_2_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait… the ones we have to wear? Like, with the skirts and the blazers? The one I’m wearing right now?
taliyah_2_scene_290_text: speaker_taliyah: They’re not really… hm… my style, I guess. So I don’t really like being seen in them. Anywhere.
taliyah_2_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course! That’s why you get changed before we hang out!
taliyah_2_scene_310_text: speaker_taliyah: Right, exactly! I dunno. I don’t like the way those uniforms look on me. They aren’t very… pretty. O-on me! You look fine!
taliyah_2_scene_320_text: speaker_taliyah: Now that I’m in high school, I’ve been trying to figure out my own sense of style… but…
taliyah_2_scene_340_text: speaker_taliyah: Yeah… Sorry, Captain. I know how much you like training… and being a Star Guardian…

taliyah_2_scene_350_text: speaker_taliyah: I like it, too! But… hmm… after the invasion, I spent a lot of time helping my family rebuild. We live by the shops, and a lot of the buildings were badly damaged in the attack.
taliyah_2_scene_360_text: speaker_taliyah: I was going through a lot back then… N-not that everyone else wasn’t! But I felt like I had to put my problems on hold.
taliyah_2_scene_370_text: speaker_taliyah: Then I met you and Akali, I took the oath, and we all started training… Then school started up again… It all happened so fast…

taliyah_2_scene_380_text: speaker_taliyah: Until I can figure out the way I want to dress, I’d rather wear this big hoodie. Then I can make my, you know, fashion debut… without anyone telling me how I should dress.
taliyah_2_scene_390_text: speaker_taliyah: I-if that makes sense!
taliyah_2_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: Huh… a fashion problem. You’re so confident as a Star Guardian… I never would have guessed.

taliyah_2_scene_410_text: speaker_taliyah: Like I said, the Star Guardian outfit makes me feel like the person I want to be! If I can find some clothes like that… Well, maybe without the magical space powers…
taliyah_2_scene_420_text: speaker_taliyah: I’m sure I could throw this ratty old hoodie away for good!
taliyah_2_scene_430_text: speaker_taliyah: Uh… and maybe be more confident… at school. A-and other places. Here. The park. Etcetera.
taliyah_2_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, as your captain, I’d love to help! Only if you’ll let me, of course.
taliyah_2_scene_460_text: speaker_taliyah: You’re more than my captain, Cap… uh, Kai’Sa. We’re friends! I-I think!
taliyah_2_scene_470_text: speaker_taliyah: Though, uh… you’re not exactly the most… um…
taliyah_2_scene_490_text: speaker_taliyah: Please, don’t be mad!
taliyah_2_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: Hmm. You know who’s really on top of fashion trends? Akali.
taliyah_2_scene_530_text: speaker_taliyah: Oh… but are you two alright? You both seem… strained?
taliyah_2_scene_540_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh... I don’t know. I think we’re okay? It’s… complicated.
taliyah_2_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: Regardless! She really likes you, so she’ll totally help update your look!
taliyah_2_scene_560_text: speaker_taliyah: Really?! Oh, Captain, that’s amazing! Thank you!
taliyah_2_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course, Tali! You’re my—
taliyah_2_scene_580_text: speaker_kaisa: Ow, ow, ow, my back. My sides. My legs. My head. Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow…
taliyah_2_scene_590_text: speaker_taliyah: Argh! I’m really, really sorry! I never should have made you ride the pain train!
taliyah_2_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: Café Cuties Bard… take me away…
taliyah_2_scene_500a_10_text: speaker_taliyah: A-and there’s nothing wrong with that, Captain!
taliyah_2_scene_500a_20_text: speaker_taliyah: But, you know, it’s not for me.
taliyah_2_scene_500b_10_text: speaker_taliyah: I’ve been reading a lot of fashion magazines… and I don’t think that’s a thing.
taliyah_2_scene_500b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: It could be a thing.
taliyah_2_scene_500c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m going to build a giant, evil castle. With spikes. It’ll be awesome, and you can’t hang out in it.
taliyah_2_scene_500c_30_text: speaker_taliyah: Oh… you’re joking. Whew.
taliyah_3_scene_10_text: speaker_taliyah: Uh… I dunno about this one…
taliyah_3_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I think it looks nice.
taliyah_3_scene_30_text: speaker_akali: You’re not looking with a critical eye. You want to accentuate the hips and waistline while drawing the eye across the midsection.
taliyah_3_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: I don’t know what that means.
taliyah_3_scene_50_text: speaker_akali: Kai, I love you. You know I do. Now get out of this dressing room right now before I stab you.
taliyah_3_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, that’s your fault. Just because you can pull off a bucket hat, doesn’t mean everyone can!
taliyah_3_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: And what’s so bad about jeggings?! They’re for work and for play!
taliyah_3_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: Whatever. Stupid alpaca. Telling me what to do. You don’t even have hands.
taliyah_3_scene_160_text: speaker_taliyah: Sorry, everyone! I don’t mean to be a bother!
taliyah_3_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: Thank you, Aru! That’s a very good point!
taliyah_3_scene_190_text: speaker_akali: We may not know what works, but we did find out what doesn’t work. That means we’re getting close.
taliyah_3_scene_220_text: speaker_akali: Kai, I wouldn’t expect you to know this because your personal fashion is whatever the rules say is mandatory…
taliyah_3_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: Hmph. At least it’s functional.

taliyah_3_scene_240_text: speaker_akali: But Taliyah requires a deft, and fashionable, hand. Process of elimination is still a process. I’m pretty sure you told me that in a very boring speech about something.
taliyah_3_scene_260_text: speaker_akali: And I only say that because I love you.
taliyah_3_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh, fine. I’ll give you a pass.
taliyah_3_scene_280_text: speaker_akali: Thatta girl. Now… Taliyah.
taliyah_3_scene_300_text: speaker_akali: Hmm… I have some ideas. Stick here with Kai while I grab some stuff from different stores.
taliyah_3_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re not gonna shoplift, are you?!
taliyah_3_scene_320_text: speaker_akali: Oh, what’s that? I need Aru’s help for an undisclosed reason? Come on, little buddy. Let’s make some magic happen.
taliyah_3_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh… My dad’s gonna kill me…
taliyah_3_scene_360_text: speaker_taliyah: Heh heh. You two are funny.
taliyah_3_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: …We are. We’re pretty funny.
taliyah_3_scene_380_text: speaker_taliyah: I hope this works… I would love to find something I can wear that isn’t, you know, gonna blow our cover and reveal our secret identities to the world.
taliyah_3_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: Don’t worry about that right now. Akali has… unconventional methods… but I bet she’ll know what to do.
taliyah_3_scene_410_text: speaker_taliyah: I just wanna figure out my own look. It feels so frustrating… This should have been really easy!
taliyah_3_scene_420_text: speaker_taliyah: Every other girl in school did it! I see you all walking around on the weekends… You all look amazing, while I’m balled up in this big, dumb hoodie.
taliyah_3_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: Dumb? Why’s the hoodie dumb? I thought it was part of the mystique of figuring out your, you know… big fashion debut.
taliyah_3_scene_440_text: speaker_taliyah: I mean… sure… That’s true…
taliyah_3_scene_450_text: speaker_taliyah: It’s also one of the only things we saved from our old house.
taliyah_3_scene_460_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, Tali… I’m sorry…
taliyah_3_scene_470_text: speaker_taliyah: N-no, no! It’s not that bad! Everybody came together in our neighborhood and built it all back a hundred times better!
taliyah_3_scene_480_text: speaker_taliyah: It just feels like… this hoodie is holding me back in that time...
taliyah_3_scene_490_text: speaker_taliyah: Like… I can’t move on. I know, it sounds really dumb. But that’s the way I feel.
taliyah_3_scene_500_text: speaker_taliyah: Have you ever felt like you can’t move on, Captain?
taliyah_3_scene_520_text: speaker_taliyah: S-seems like we both have some ghosts.
taliyah_3_scene_540_text: speaker_kaisa: But we’ll figure it out together.
taliyah_3_scene_570_text: speaker_akali: Hello! We need to go right now! I may have gone overboard!
taliyah_3_scene_580_text: speaker_security: Hey! Someone stop that girl and her weird, tall dog!
taliyah_3_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: We can talk about this later! Book it!
taliyah_3_scene_610_text: speaker_taliyah: Well? What do you bad dudes think?
taliyah_3_scene_620_text: speaker_taliyah: I think I look hot. But approachable. Also, I could kick a monster off the top of a skyscraper. Star kick! Chu chu!
taliyah_3_scene_630_text: speaker_akali: There she is. That’s the Taliyah I know.
taliyah_3_scene_640_text: speaker_kaisa: Glad you found your look, Tali. Wanna wear it out? Maybe kick a villain off a skyscraper?
taliyah_3_scene_650_text: speaker_taliyah: Soon, all will be revealed! But not yet. I wanna save it for the exact right moment.
taliyah_3_scene_660_text: speaker_taliyah: Alright, hoodie, looks like you and I are gonna do one last big score before retirement. Yee-haw!
taliyah_3_scene_670_text: speaker_taliyah: Oh, wow. The tag says these leggings are… oh, wow.
taliyah_3_scene_680_text: speaker_kaisa: Kali, how much did these clothes cost?
taliyah_3_scene_690_text: speaker_akali: They were free. Shut up.
taliyah_3_scene_700_text: speaker_kaisa: Those are crazy-expensive designer brands. What did you do?!
taliyah_3_scene_710_text: speaker_akali: I did what had to be done, O Great and Mighty Captain.
taliyah_3_scene_720_text: speaker_akali: Also, I may be banned from the bottom floor of the mall until their security team retires. No big deal.
taliyah_3_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: We’ll talk about this later.
taliyah_3_scene_740_text: speaker_taliyah: Aaaaand I’m back. What were you two talking about? Doing crimes?
taliyah_3_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: Tali! You’re in your academy outfit?!
taliyah_3_scene_760_text: speaker_akali: I thought you hated that thing?!
taliyah_3_scene_770_text: speaker_taliyah: Yeah, I did. But after seeing myself in my awesome new outfit…
taliyah_3_scene_780_text: speaker_taliyah: ...I realized maybe it’s not the clothes holding me back. It’s just me. But now… I feel really good.
taliyah_3_scene_790_text: speaker_taliyah: I know I can look cute and kick butt. I wasn’t so sure before… but even having one look set aside really makes a difference.
taliyah_3_scene_800_text: speaker_taliyah: Thanks, to both of you. I really mean it.
taliyah_3_scene_810_text: speaker_taliyah: I still hate these stupid outfits, though. When we graduate, let's burn them.
taliyah_3_scene_820_text: speaker_akali: New best friend. Kai’Sa, you’re demoted.
taliyah_3_scene_830_text: speaker_kaisa: Taliyah… Here's your gun and badge. Respect the code of the best friend, and please promise not to commit any more mall crimes.
taliyah_3_scene_840_text: speaker_taliyah: I will literally only do mall crimes.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_10_text: speaker_kaisa: My mom passing was pretty tough. I still think about it sometimes.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_20_text: speaker_taliyah: I-I’m sorry! I didn’t know!
taliyah_3_scene_510a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s alright. It happened a long time ago. I was really young.
taliyah_3_scene_510a_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Part of it… never goes away. You learn to cope.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_10_text: speaker_taliyah: Seems like that night hit everybody pretty hard.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I was there, Tali. At the epicenter… right in the middle of the battle.
taliyah_3_scene_510b_40_text: speaker_kaisa: It feels like I’m still there sometimes. I hope, one day, that changes.
taliyah_3_scene_510c_10_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s not fair! He just wants to be with his wife!
taliyah_3_scene_510c_20_text: speaker_taliyah: M-maybe you’ve been getting too into the Café Cuties canon…

taliyah_3_scene_510c_30_text: speaker_kaisa: It doesn’t make any sense! If Bard has the cosmic power of brewing the perfect cup of tea, why can’t Vladimir just give Viego the magical hibiscus fragments?!
taliyah_3_scene_510c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Taliyah, you have made me this way, and that is why we are enemies. I cherish your friendship. We are enemies.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: Kali! Hey! Stop walking so fast!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: I can explain! Would you just listen to me for a minute?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Please! I didn’t have a choice!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_50_text: speaker_akali: You didn’t have a choice?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_60_text: speaker_akali: It’s bad enough to have Morgana standing in front of the class every day, but you…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_70_text: speaker_akali: You want me to work with Zoe? Do you not remember what she did?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course, I remember! I was there during the invasion! I saw what happened!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_90_text: speaker_akali: I don’t know what you saw. Obviously something different from what I saw.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_100_text: speaker_akali: I watched a paddle star destroy my old neighborhood. A building collapsed next to me with people still inside. I saw a Star Guardian actually die.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_110_text: speaker_akali: You saw… what? Lux saving the day? Being a big hero, getting a statue? They left us, Kai’Sa.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_120_text: speaker_akali: The old guardians are all gone. All of them! They left us here to do this ourselves, and now, I…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_130_text: speaker_akali: I am being hunted and tortured by that… that thing. I can’t even go home at night by myself. I hear it everywhere. It’s following me!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: Akali, I can fix this. The guardians aren’t gone! Syndra said—
chapter_2_act_2_scene_150_text: speaker_akali: Stop. Don’t even say her name. As a matter of fact, don’t even say my name. Don’t talk to me, period.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_160_text: speaker_akali: Your obsession with being a Star Guardian is… I can’t deal with it anymore. Do you even care how I feel? Do you know what I see when I close my eyes?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_170_text: speaker_akali: So many people I cared about are dead. And now there’s nothing stopping me from dying, too. And you don’t even care.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: I took this stupid oath because I believed in you! You promised nothing would change!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_200_text: speaker_akali: I need you to tell me we’re going to win this... that everything will be fine.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_210_text: speaker_akali: And I need you to mean it.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: …I’m just trying to protect everyone.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_240_text: speaker_akali: Oh, really? Did you tell Sona about Zoe? She sure does love loud noises and crowds after being traumatized by explosions!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_250_text: speaker_akali: What about Taliyah, who’s so confident at school? Or maybe Ekko? Our friend obsessed with literally changing the past?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: They… Yeah, they weren’t happy.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_270_text: speaker_akali: Wow. Shocker. Kai’Sa the leader didn’t check in beforehand.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_280_text: speaker_akali: We’re done here. I’m sure Fiddlesticks will be a delightful walking companion, whenever and wherever it decides to tell me that I’m going to die.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: I just… I want to protect you all like Lux did…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: Why can’t I protect you...?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_330_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Well, well! If it isn’t Miss Kai’Sa herself! Welcome back to Noodle Bill’s!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_340_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Can I treat you to the usual, or...?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_360_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Let me whip something up for you. On the house.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_370_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Until then, take a load off! Relax a little. You can eat with your friend.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: Syndra?! But… you’re… you!? And in your uniform?! What about… but… your identity?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_410_text: speaker_syndra: Heh. I suppose it’s a bit surprising to see me here.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_420_text: speaker_syndra: But, as the saying goes… “everyone loves Noodle Bill’s.”
chapter_2_act_2_scene_430_text: speaker_syndra: Don’t worry about him, by the way. The man can keep a secret.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_440_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Your friends show up here in uniform all the time. Benefit of being open late—lots of Star Guardian regulars, and they show up very hungry.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: [Ugh… Akali...! Or Ekko? Maybe Taliyah…]
chapter_2_act_2_scene_460_text: speaker_noodle_bill: It’s all of them. And you, twice.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_470_text: speaker_kaisa: M…me?! TWICE?! I don’t even—!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_480_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Don’t be too hard on yourself. Syndra’s friends were even worse.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_490_text: speaker_noodle_bill: In fact, I seem to remember…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_500_text: speaker_syndra: Bill, please, not another one of your stories.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_510_text: speaker_noodle_bill: What was the bird girl’s name... Xayah! Boy, she used to show up at the strangest hours, and always with that Rakan…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_520_text: speaker_syndra: Ugh. Those two. By the time I met them, they were… different… but still, so much PDA…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_540_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I’ve been serving Star Guardians a long, long time. Don’t worry. Your identity is safe with me.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_550_text: speaker_syndra: And for that, we thank you.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: Huh… I guess I assumed the old Star Guardians were always saving the day from evil… I didn’t really consider they had another side to them.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_580_text: speaker_syndra: More like saving the day from Jinx’s little temper tantrums. Or Sarah refusing to talk to anyone or show up for anything.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_590_text: speaker_syndra: We weren’t that different, Kai’Sa. Most of the group was still in high school… like you and your friends.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_600_text: speaker_syndra: We had fights, there were falling-outs, people made up. Usually crying. Sometimes ugly crying, with snot.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_610_text: speaker_syndra: Everyone was constantly embroiled in drama, and there was always some new, horrible monster to fight.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_620_text: speaker_syndra: It was… nice. Reminded me of… well, my first team. Zoe’s team.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, yeah… You mentioned that before. Huh, you and Zoe.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_640_text: speaker_kaisa: Now that you’ve brought it up, I have to ask…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_660_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Ramen’s ready, Miss Kai’Sa. I gave you extra fish cakes, just the way you like it.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, wow...! This aroma...!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_680_text: speaker_noodle_bill: That’s the “Star Guardians having a personal problem” special. I came up with it, oh, three teams ago? Four? I’m old... Who can remember?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: Four teams ago?! How many times have you served this?!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_700_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Ha! Who knows? Anyway, enjoy.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_720_text: speaker_syndra: The point is, Kai’Sa, that every team has problems. Some are just part of life, but others…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_740_text: speaker_syndra: Zoe and I… We had the chance to save our teammate from Fiddlesticks. But we didn’t. And in the end, that failure destroyed us.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: So that’s why you’re really here…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_760_text: speaker_syndra: Correct. In a way… it’s to put our friends to rest. Something we should have done long ago.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_770_text: speaker_syndra: Don’t make the same mistakes we did. Not if you don’t have to.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_790_text: speaker_syndra: Ah, but it’s late. I should be going.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_800_text: speaker_syndra: I will see you when the creature surfaces, little guardian. I hope you are prepared for the fight to come.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_820_text: speaker_kaisa: Star Guardians are meant to fall, huh…?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_830_text: speaker_kaisa: Akali… No. I won’t let you.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220a_20_text: speaker_akali: I’ll be there the next time there’s a monster attack. But you and I? Nah.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220a_30_text: speaker_akali: I don’t want to hear from you unless it’s a life-or-death situation. “Best friends.” Pfft.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220a_40_text: speaker_akali: Just stay away from me.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_10_text: speaker_akali: Heh. You’re that confident?
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_20_text: speaker_akali: You know, I tried to follow you. When you went to talk to that creepy-eyed little murderer.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_30_text: speaker_akali: Guess what happened? I was attacked by Fiddlesticks. Again! And you didn’t even notice.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220b_40_text: speaker_akali: It’s happening almost every day. I can hear it in my room at night. But, oh, you have to be a leader. You have to “be a Star Guardian.”
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_20_text: speaker_akali: Let me make things clear for you right now, since you’re the big leader of the Star Guardians.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_30_text: speaker_akali: A woman from nowhere is teaching homeroom in our grade, and sometimes, she decides to summon hundreds of monsters to attack people in the streets.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_40_text: speaker_akali: I am being hunted… like an animal… by… I don’t even know how to describe it. But I’m pretty sure it’s going to kill me.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_220c_50_text: speaker_akali: And now, you're gonna make us team up with Zoe—the source of all our nightmares, the reason this all happened!
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650a_20_text: speaker_syndra: Gwen, Akshan, Zoe, myself… and Harp. Most are gone now. Fallen. The ultimate fate of all guardians.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650a_40_text: speaker_syndra: Sadly, yes. They were kind, gentle souls… Even Zoe, if you can imagine it. Even Akshan, who hated putting on his shirt for some reason.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_10_text: speaker_syndra: Hm. It might be difficult to understand, but… she found a loophole in the oath.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_20_text: speaker_syndra: “Star Guardians burn bright, but all are fated to fall.” We’re killed in battle, or lost… or worse. It’s the price of doing good.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait, so she thought she was… helping people?

chapter_2_act_2_scene_650b_40_text: speaker_syndra: By killing and resurrecting guardians, Zoe voided the contract with the First Star. She… believed she was saving them. Though… There were unintended consequences.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_20_text: speaker_syndra: Something… happened… to one of our companions. Something we didn’t know was possible. Though, in hindsight, it should have been obvious.
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_30_text: speaker_syndra: They fell. Zoe couldn’t handle it. She vanished… only to return, twisted and deranged. And then… she… our team…
chapter_2_act_2_scene_650c_40_text: speaker_syndra: …I’m sorry. It happened so long ago, but it’s difficult to talk about.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_50_text: speaker_zoe: Wahhh, it’s a big scary monster! Oh no! What will I doooo?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_60_text: speaker_zoe: OH, I REMEMBER NOW!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_70_text: speaker_zoe: I’M A MONSTER, TOO! MYAHAHAHA!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_80_text: speaker_syndra: Well, well. The power of chaos… The Twilight Star. I haven’t seen this sort of display in a while.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_90_text: speaker_zoe: ISN’T IT FUN!? I’M GONNA PAINT THE WALLS WITH THAT THING’S FACE!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_100_text: speaker_zoe: GO AHEAD, SYNDRA! THIS MONSTER KILLED HARP! TAKE OFF THE EYE PATCH AND REALLY LET LOOSE!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_120_text: speaker_syndra: Let’s see if our new friends show up, first.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_130_text: speaker_zoe: OH, BOO! BREAK OUT OF YOUR COMFORT ZONE! MYAHAHA!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_140_text: speaker_syndra: Only if I have to. You know what will happen when I do.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_150_text: speaker_zoe: KNOW?! SYNDRA, I’M COUNTING ON IT!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Alright, is everyone here?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_170_text: speaker_ekko: I’m here, but I want it on the record that I don’t like this.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_180_text: speaker_taliyah: Seconded. This sucks, Kai’Sa.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_210_text: speaker_sona: [“She can read sign language, Ekko.”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_220_text: speaker_ekko: I don’t know that! Where’s the annoying rat thing that’s always yelling?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_230_text: speaker_chiizu: Sob, sob… tossed aside! Left behind! Traded in like an old piece of cheese!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_240_text: speaker_chiizu: It’s hard to paint such vivid pictures with words...! Oh, my artist’s pride...!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: Hey! Focus up! This is serious!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: I know you’re all upset with me, but Fiddlesticks is a huge threat to the city, and a bigger threat to us.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: This might be our only chance to stop it… even if we have to team up with someone like Zoe.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh! Good. That’s… I’m glad you’re okay.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_330_text: speaker_akali: Well, meet you out there.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_340_text: speaker_taliyah: …Has Akali been getting enough sleep? She looks exhausted.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_350_text: speaker_sona: [“Something’s not right. Kai’Sa, what’s been going on?”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: …Fiddlesticks has been hunting Akali. I don’t know for how long.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: But if we don’t stop it here… eventually, it’s going to kill her.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: I… I didn’t stop it when I could have. And I didn’t tell any of you… I just… I thought I could fix it…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_400_text: speaker_ekko: We’ll stop it. Here. Today.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_410_text: speaker_taliyah: Yeah! This is the biggest monster we’ve fought so far! And I’m still pumped up from last time!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_420_text: speaker_taliyah: Round two, baby! I’m gonna punch its head!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_430_text: speaker_sona: [“We can talk it out later. For now, we fight.”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Thank you. Let’s clean house.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_490_text: speaker_syndra: We’re on its home turf now. It’s at the height of its power here.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_500_text: speaker_syndra: Fiddlesticks is more than any one of us can handle alone. We’ll need to attack together, or nobody’s leaving this place alive.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_510_text: speaker_zoe: SO NICE OF YOU TO JOIN US, WIDDLE STAR GUARDIAN! EVER SEEN A CHAOS DIMENSION BEFORE!?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_520_text: speaker_zoe: AS FAR AS THEY GO, THIS ONE’S NOT BAD! SHAME I HAVE TO RIP IT APART! MYAHAHA!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_540_text: speaker_ekko: No way… We have to fight alongside the Twilight Star…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_550_text: speaker_taliyah: I… I’ll do it! I’m not backing down!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: Don’t worry, guardians. Remember, she’s on our side this time.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: Akali, are you with me?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_580_text: speaker_akali: …I’ll take the rear. I was able to hide from this thing in the shadows. Might help take it off guard.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_590_text: speaker_akali: Not being seen suits me anyway.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_600_text: speaker_ekko: I’ll go with her. Just in case.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: Alright, Ekko. Be careful. Everyone else, follow Syndra and Zoe! We fight together!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_620_text: speaker_syndra: …Heh. Brings back memories, doesn’t it?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_660_text: speaker_syndra: The dark, huh? Poor choice of words!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_670_text: speaker_zoe: YOU’LL PAY FOR WHAT YOU DID TO HARP! FEED THE FLAME OF CHAOS!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_680_text: speaker_taliyah: I don’t have the flame of chaos or whatever, but I’m plenty strong enough to deal with this chess freak!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_690_text: speaker_sona: [“You made a big mistake hurting my friend. Now, it’s personal.”]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_700_text: speaker_kaisa: I won’t let you take Akali! I won’t let you hurt anyone ever again!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh… It’s too strong! We didn’t even make a dent!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_740_text: speaker_akali: Kai’Sa. That cage in the center has a familiar trapped inside. I think that’s the weak point.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: A familiar…? Right! Once more, everyone! This time, aim for the cage!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_770_text: speaker_akali: An enemy… has been slain.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_780_text: speaker_akali: Always wanted to say that. Not as cool as I hoped.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_790_text: speaker_kaisa: Is it… Is it finally over…?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_800_text: speaker_akali: I think so… hey, what’s that? Are you seeing that?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_810_text: speaker_kaisa: Is it… a girl?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_840_text: speaker_harp: Zoe… It’s so good to see you again.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_850_text: speaker_harp: And you brought Syndra, too? What a reunion… I wish Gwen and Akshan could be here for this…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_860_text: speaker_harp: Seems like I’ve made a real mess of everything… Guess we should have paid more attention to those oaths…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_890_text: speaker_kaisa: Syndra, what’s going on? Is that… your old teammate?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_900_text: speaker_syndra: The fate of every guardian is to fall, Kai’Sa.

chapter_2_act_3_scene_910_text: speaker_syndra: Harp was the first, ever. She burned so brightly… brighter than anyone in the universe… but the First Star had tricked us, and soon enough, she burned away.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_920_text: speaker_syndra: We couldn’t forgive ourselves after we saw what she became. An undying monster, drawn to guardians on the edge of darkness.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_950_text: speaker_zoe: Harp! I’m sorry! I’m sorry-I’m sorry-I’m sorry!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_960_text: speaker_zoe: I tried to save all the guardians I could! I had to kill them! I couldn’t let anyone fall again!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_970_text: speaker_zoe: Harp… P-please! I was helping! You have to believe me...!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_980_text: speaker_harp: Zoe… my best friend… I’m the one who’s sorry. I thought I could keep going… but… I miscalculated… What a novice move…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_990_text: speaker_harp: I… forgive you… Zoe…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1000_text: speaker_zoe: No! NO! I WON’T LET YOU GO!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1010_text: speaker_zoe: I’LL KILL EVERYONE! I’LL DESTROY EVERYTHING! YOU CAN’T LEAVE ME ALL ALONE AGAIN!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1020_text: speaker_harp: Ha… ha… It’s okay… Zoe…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1030_text: speaker_harp: I will always… be your best friend… no… matter… what…
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1050_text: speaker_kaisa: Huh? Where’d everybody go?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1060_text: speaker_akali: Ekko? Sona? Tali? H-hello?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1070_text: speaker_zoe: …They’re fine. In your stupid city, probably.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1100_text: speaker_zoe: Shut up and listen to what I have to say. I’m leaving. For now, anyway.

chapter_2_act_3_scene_1110_text: speaker_zoe: I don’t know when, but I’ll be back. And when that happens… we’re going to be enemies. You, and me, and all of them, too. I’ll kill every last one of you.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1160_text: speaker_syndra: All those years… Time really does fly, doesn’t it?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1170_text: speaker_syndra: [Hm. Myself, Zoe, Morgana, and Fiddlesticks, all in the same place… With so many powerful opponents, she won’t be able to resist the challenge.]
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1180_text: speaker_syndra: Kai’Sa. I am also leaving.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1190_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait, why? You could join us! We could protect the world together!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1200_text: speaker_syndra: You’ll be fine. A powerful Outer Guardian is already on her way.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1210_text: speaker_syndra: Putting Harp to rest was… the last thing I needed to do here. I am done now. My time as a hero has ended.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1220_text: speaker_akali: Hey… What are you talking about...? You protected the city from Zoe! There are plushies of you! I own, like, three!
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1230_text: speaker_syndra: I understand your confusion, but I am part of a darker story. A… star in another sky. And it is well past time that I returned.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1240_text: speaker_syndra: We will also meet again, young guardians. Pray it is not soon.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1250_text: speaker_kaisa: What’s that supposed to mean? What aren’t you telling us?
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1280_text: speaker_syndra: The stars are finally out, guardians… Don’t worry, my old friend will treat you well.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_1290_text: speaker_syndra: Train them to be strong, Nilah. They will need it for the trials to come.
