chapter_2_act_3_scene_320a_10_text: speaker_akali: Yeah. Whatever. Let’s just kill this thing and get out of here.
chapter_2_act_3_scene_320b_10_text: speaker_akali: Yeah. Whatever. Let’s just kill this thing and get out of here.
kaisa_3_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I know! I can’t believe I slept in so late!
kaisa_3_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: But I’m actually feeling more refreshed than I have in… months.
kaisa_3_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: There’s no need to say “I told you so…”
kaisa_3_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: But you were right. And Noodle Bill was right.
kaisa_3_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s important to find a work/life/school/Star Guardian balance.
kaisa_3_scene_90_text: speaker_kaisa: I almost forgot what it was like to sleep in after staying up late watching documentaries… eating an acceptable number of healthy snacks… staying hydrated…
kaisa_3_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: You know, typical high schooler stuff!
kaisa_3_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: Wh-what!? I can be a typical high schooler! I didn’t even make plans today!
kaisa_3_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m chill Kai’Sa. I just go with the flow.
kaisa_3_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: No more drills. Promise.
kaisa_3_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: What do you want to do, Waku?
kaisa_3_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: Does anyone have any suggestions that don’t involve time travel?
kaisa_3_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: Rock surfing sounds pretty… cool… I guess…
kaisa_3_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: No! I’m not just saying that! I’m sure it’s a lot of fun.
kaisa_3_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: I just don’t know where the nearest quarry is… or how to surf… Also, rocks are very hard…
kaisa_3_scene_270_text: speaker_chiizu: I know something we all could do!
kaisa_3_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait… Did you stay up all night? You look… unwell.
kaisa_3_scene_310_text: speaker_chiizu: I had to finish the show we started…
kaisa_3_scene_320_text: speaker_chiizu: And then another show started…
kaisa_3_scene_330_text: speaker_chiizu: Do you know how many shows there are? THERE ARE SO MANY!!!
kaisa_3_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: Uh… Don’t worry, guys. I’m… sure… Chiizu will be okay.
kaisa_3_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: Umi! …We never really talked about what happened.
kaisa_3_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: You know exactly what I’m talking about.
kaisa_3_scene_390_text: speaker_kaisa: Why did you fly off?
kaisa_3_scene_410_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course I’d notice if you were gone!
kaisa_3_scene_420_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re my best friend… ’s familiar. My best friend’s familiar.
kaisa_3_scene_440_text: speaker_kaisa: Do you want to do something today?
kaisa_3_scene_450_text: speaker_chiizu: Forget that! We could watch more TV!
kaisa_3_scene_470_text: speaker_chiizu: I’m not addicted! I CAN STOP ANYTIME!
kaisa_3_scene_480_text: speaker_chiizu: It’s only one thousand episodes. How long can it take? [shivers]
kaisa_3_scene_500_text: speaker_kaisa: A trip to the park sounds perfect, Umi.
kaisa_3_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: I know at least one of us could use some outdoor time.
kaisa_3_scene_520_text: speaker_chiizu: Hey, what are you doing? DON’T TOUCH THE REMOTE!
kaisa_3_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: Ahhh… this is the life.
kaisa_3_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: Only thing that would make it better would be…
kaisa_3_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: Ever since we became Star Guardians, we haven’t really had a chance to relax.
kaisa_3_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: Even though she begs for breaks all the time. Ugh, what am I doing? Why can’t I just be normal sometimes?
kaisa_3_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: I guess somewhere along the line, I forgot how to be… me. The me before I took the oath.
kaisa_3_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah. You’re right. I can’t lose sight of what’s important—friends to rely on when the fighting ends.
kaisa_3_scene_640_text: speaker_kaisa: …I’m sure it’ll end. One day. It has to.
kaisa_3_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: Haha! And good ramen is important, too. How could I forget?
kaisa_3_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah… a nice, big meal… to share with a friend…
kaisa_3_scene_340a_10_text: speaker_chiizu: SLEEP?! I don’t need sleep! If I sleep, I can’t watch the screen!
kaisa_3_scene_340b_10_text: speaker_chiizu: I can do it! I just need to watch several at the same time.
kaisa_3_scene_340b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: …But then they won’t make any sense to you.
kaisa_3_scene_340b_30_text: speaker_chiizu: It’s not about them making sense. It’s about sEEing aLL tHe piCTurES on tHe scrEEn!
kaisa_3_scene_340c_10_text: speaker_chiizu: Oh, no… How many shows are on there?
kaisa_3_scene_340c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Unlimited. And a lot of them are free.
kaisa_3_scene_340c_30_text: speaker_chiizu: This is too much! I-I CAN’T PROCESS THIS INFORMATION!!!!
sona_2_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: [Why would Sona possibly want to meet at the mall now?]
sona_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: [Half the stores are closed!]
sona_2_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh! Hi, Sona! Good to see you at the… crack of dawn?
sona_2_scene_60_text: speaker_chiizu: Good morning, Miss Kai’Sa!
sona_2_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: And hello to you, Chiizu.
sona_2_scene_90_text: speaker_chiizu: Thank you for meeting us here so early.
sona_2_scene_100_text: speaker_chiizu: I know it may seem strange to you, but there’s a good reason we chose this place!
sona_2_scene_120_text: speaker_chiizu: W..what?! There is a good reason! I was just adding that part for clarity!
sona_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s fine, really! I guess we aren’t here to shop, though…
sona_2_scene_150_text: speaker_chiizu: "Maybe later! I was actually hoping to find some books for school."
sona_2_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Chiizu… you can read?
sona_2_scene_170_text: speaker_sona: [Sona forms two L shapes with her hands, tracing along the form of her smile.]
sona_2_scene_180_text: speaker_chiizu: Like I said before, I’m simply translating for Miss Sona. I have no use for academic books! They’re heavy, and very painful when thrown!
sona_2_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: Right, I always forget you’re basically a magic butler.
sona_2_scene_210_text: speaker_chiizu: It’s not funny! I’m a powerful magical being from beyond the stars, squeak!
sona_2_scene_220_text: speaker_chiizu: Ahem… We chose this time because the mall is much less crowded.
sona_2_scene_230_text: speaker_chiizu: And less people means less noise. Too much noise drowns out my thoughts.
sona_2_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: Drowns out your… What do you mean by that?
sona_2_scene_250_text: speaker_chiizu: It all started one year ago, almost to the day…
sona_2_scene_260_text: speaker_chiizu: When Zoe attacked the city… Miss Sona was there. In one of the residential districts that got hit the hardest.
sona_2_scene_270_text: speaker_chiizu: Right in the center of everything.
sona_2_scene_280_text: speaker_civilian: [Run! Get out of the way! The stars are falling!]
sona_2_scene_290_text: speaker_shop_owner: [Take shelter! Take shelter before… Oh, no!]
sona_2_scene_300_text: speaker_chiizu: The destruction was deafening.
sona_2_scene_310_text: speaker_chiizu: She couldn’t move. She couldn’t breathe.
sona_2_scene_320_text: speaker_chiizu: Miss Sona could only watch as her neighborhood was blasted to rubble.
sona_2_scene_340_text: speaker_chiizu: “Screams merged with the sounds of the city. The sirens. The blaring horns.”
sona_2_scene_350_text: speaker_chiizu: “I heard terrible things. It still rings in my ears like a dissonant chorus.”
sona_2_scene_360_text: speaker_chiizu: That’s why Miss Sona is always late for class.
sona_2_scene_370_text: speaker_chiizu: She waits for the rush of people to stop. Businessmen at the train station, students at the school. And of course, for the bell to stop ringing.
sona_2_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona… I had no idea. I’m so sorry.
sona_2_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: What’s that mean, Chiizu?
sona_2_scene_410_text: speaker_chiizu: Miss Sona says, “I’m a Star Guardian now.”
sona_2_scene_420_text: speaker_chiizu: When she puts on the uniform… everything is easier.
sona_2_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s really nice to hear. I’m glad she has you by her side, Chiizu.
sona_2_scene_440_text: speaker_chiizu: Don’t worry, Miss Kai’Sa, I’m not going anywhere! I’m brave and strong, just like Miss Sona!
sona_2_scene_470_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Was that a— ? Hmm… nevermind.
sona_2_scene_490_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Hi! My name is Mimi!
sona_2_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: Right. All the noise must have scared her off.
sona_2_scene_520_text: speaker_kaisa: Uh, well… Nice costume, I guess.
sona_2_scene_530_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Costume? Whatever do you mean?
sona_2_scene_560_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Don’t forget! It’s Skeeball Sunday! Unlimited rounds all day, only at Arcade World!
sona_2_scene_570_text: speaker_kid: Mommy, look! It’s Mimi!
sona_2_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: Well that was exciting. Looks like the mall is starting to get crowded.
sona_2_scene_600_text: speaker_sona: [Sona once more forms two Ls, tracing her smile.]
sona_2_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: Ha. You can trust me, Sona. If you’re ever feeling… you know, overwhelmed, I’ll do my best to help.
sona_2_scene_630_text: speaker_gamer: Come on! The arcade’s opening!
sona_2_scene_640_text: speaker_hardcore_gamer: SKEEBALL SUNDAY! LET’S GO!
sona_2_scene_650_text: speaker_kaisa: [Uh-oh. That’s a lot of gamers.]
sona_2_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona, it’ll be alright. Just take deep breaths.
sona_2_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: [That’s what people say, right?]
sona_2_scene_680_text: speaker_sona: [Sona takes in short, gasping breaths.]
sona_2_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: Crap. This isn’t working.
sona_2_scene_700_text: speaker_kaisa: Uh… Sona! Do you hear that?
sona_2_scene_720_text: speaker_kaisa: Try focusing on just one sound...
sona_2_scene_730_text: speaker_sona: [Sona pauses, listening for a second.]
sona_2_scene_750_text: speaker_gamer: New high score! Take THAT, Omega Cypher!
sona_2_scene_790_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona, how can I help?
sona_2_scene_800_text: speaker_sona: [Sona winces, lowering her hands from her ears to sign.]
sona_2_scene_810_text: speaker_kaisa: Where is Chiizu?! Ugh, that stupid mall mascot ruined everything!
sona_2_scene_820_text: speaker_kaisa: Sorry, Sona. I… don’t understand.
sona_2_scene_850_text: speaker_kaisa: We… never got your books.
sona_2_scene_540a_10_text: speaker_mall_mascot: No… I’m real! As real as the Star Guardians themselves!
sona_2_scene_540a_20_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Come on, man! You’re ruining it for the kids!
sona_2_scene_540a_40_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Okay, don’t overdo it.
sona_2_scene_540b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re much bigger than I remember.
sona_2_scene_540b_30_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Yeah, I had a growth spurt. A normal familiar thing.
sona_2_scene_540c_10_text: speaker_mall_mascot: You have a Star Guardian costume?! I’m so jealous.
sona_2_scene_540c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, it’s no big deal… kinda tight around the haunches.
sona_2_scene_540c_30_text: speaker_mall_mascot: Bet it’s not as sweaty as this one. Plus, I can’t even take it home!
sona_2_scene_540c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Why would you… take it… home? Actually, I don’t want to know.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_20_text: speaker_unknown: It’s… so… hea… vy… Akali…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: …Ugh, It feels like I’ve been in school for a thousand years.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: How did we get Instructor Puboe for homeroom? It’s like I’m in prison.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_50_text: speaker_akali: I dunno. I think I could take him.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_60_text: speaker_akali: Transform into a Star Guardian. Throw, like, a hundred knives. And then I’d say something cool, like, um...
chapter_1_act_2_scene_70_text: speaker_akali: “Take that, Puboe! You’ll never assign six-page essays on a Friday again!”
chapter_1_act_2_scene_80_text: speaker_akali: I dunno, what do you think?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_100_text: speaker_akali: …Fine. I wasn’t really going to.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_110_text: speaker_kaisa: By the way, are you training with us this weekend? You haven’t been around the past few weeks… I’ve been worried.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_120_text: speaker_akali: Oh, yeah… Maybe next time. I’m trying to catch up on some stuff…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: Akali, come on. What if monsters attack? What if the city is in danger?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: Everyone remembers Lux and Ahri and their squads. There are statues of them. We have a responsibility to protect people.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Are you just going to skip your training and let everyone down?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: Let everyone down?! What are you talking about?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_190_text: speaker_akali: I train with you all the time. All you care about anymore is being a Star Guardian! I thought you said nothing was going to change between us!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_200_text: speaker_kaisa: W-what?! Hey, we’re both leaders here!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_210_text: speaker_akali: Leaders?! Who cares! When was the last time we hung out outside of stupid training!?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: We’re hanging out now!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_230_text: speaker_akali: We’re walking home from school, and you’re still making it about being a guardian! You won’t even let me crack a joke!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: You know what? You’re right. You are right.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m sorry… I just…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: Kali… Have you been seeing things recently? Visions of the invasion?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_290_text: speaker_akali: The invasion...? Zoe’s invasion?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: I haven’t been sleeping well since school started. If I focus on the team, it’s… easier to deal with.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_320_text: speaker_akali: Kai, I’ve been seeing things too. Hearing things.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_330_text: speaker_akali: I keep thinking about that night last year… all those people…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_340_text: speaker_akali: This entire neighborhood was pummeled by falling stars. How many people died here? The city rebuilt so fast… I…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_350_text: speaker_akali: I can’t get them out of my head. It’s like I’m being haunted by their ghosts.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_360_text: speaker_akali: I keep wondering if this is what being a guardian will always feel like. I really hope it isn’t.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_370_text: speaker_akali: And now I think… I think something’s been following me.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_430_text: speaker_akali: We… We need to go…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Sure, let’s… Hey… What’s happening to the streets?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_480_text: speaker_kaisa: What… What the hell is that…? Where are we?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_490_text: speaker_akali: I… I don’t know..! Is that what’s been following me?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_500_text: speaker_akali: This fear...! Kai, I can’t transform…! I can’t focus!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: …Don’t worry. I’ve got you, Kali.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_540_text: speaker_kaisa: I’ll protect you. I’ll protect you from everything.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s what Star Guardians do.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: Hear that?! You’re not going near her! I won’t let you!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_570_text: speaker_fiddlesticks: Erh… urp... all… Star... Guardians… must…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: Huh? Is that it? Where’s it going?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: You running away? Afraid of the new guardians, huh?!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_610_text: speaker_unknown: Oh, I don’t think that’s the case at all, my sweet. You’re very lucky.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_620_text: speaker_unknown: Ah, much better. Your kind tends to prefer the shackles of an… ordered world, I believe? Can’t have all this bright purple mucking everything up.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_630_text: speaker_unknown: Regardless. My friend is far more powerful than you realize. You and that blubbering sick pile wouldn’t have stood a chance.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_640_text: speaker_kaisa: Don’t listen to her, okay?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_660_text: speaker_unknown: You were able to transform despite the aura of fear? Very impressive.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_670_text: speaker_unknown: I’ll have to keep an eye on you, won’t I? Hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_680_text: speaker_kaisa: Tell me who you are before I blow you to pieces.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_690_text: speaker_unknown: You? Oh, please. I was half expecting that monster to eat you both alive.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_700_text: speaker_unknown: It’s an odd one, though. Seems to act almost randomly… and it certainly doesn't listen to anything I have to say.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_710_text: speaker_unknown: But that makes the game more entertaining, doesn’t it? You guardians are slaves to a kind and just universe. Fiddlesticks is… free.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_730_text: speaker_unknown: You’re making some very bold demands, my darling. But you can call me… Morgana.

chapter_1_act_2_scene_740_text: speaker_morgana: Your instructor is a man named Puboe, correct? What say I pay him a visit? Relieve him of that pesky teaching position? I could use the pocket money, hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: Leave him alone! I won’t let you hurt him!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_760_text: speaker_morgana: Ah, my darling girl. You think you can stop me?
chapter_1_act_2_scene_770_text: speaker_morgana: Hmhmhm. You were right about needing that training. Would have helped you a year ago with Zoe’s little invasion.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_780_text: speaker_kaisa: How do you know about that?! If you were involved somehow...!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_790_text: speaker_morgana: Chin up, dearie. Your co-leader seems quite traumatized by this experience… You should focus on the present.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_800_text: speaker_morgana: Especially when my terrifying friend is visiting each of your teammates right now!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_810_text: speaker_morgana: Oh, hush. Your friends are… well, mostly fine. Though they may be reevaluating their membership in the Star Guardians, hmhmhm.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_820_text: speaker_morgana: And with that, toodaloo, little girl. I have places to go, and plans to further. We’ll meet again soon.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_830_text: speaker_morgana: I’m sure your team will handle this wrinkle just fine! Hmhmhmhahahahaha!
chapter_1_act_2_scene_860_text: speaker_akali: …I’m sorry, Kai… I think I need to go home…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_880_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, me too. I hope everyone’s okay.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90a_10_text: speaker_akali: Ugh, yeah, I know.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90a_20_text: speaker_akali: When did you get so serious? You never want to joke around anymore.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I can joke. Just not about abusing our powers. The guardians would never do that.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90b_10_text: speaker_akali: Ugh, yeah, I know.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90b_20_text: speaker_akali: When did you get so serious? You never want to joke around anymore.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I can joke. Just not about abusing our powers. The guardians would never do that.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: No, I’m sure they would. And a little parade would march in front of the school, and you’d get to meet the mayor.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_90c_30_text: speaker_kaisa: But seriously, don’t joke about using your powers like that. We’re supposed to be the good guys.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_10_text: speaker_akali: At first, it was just bad dreams.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_20_text: speaker_akali: I kept seeing the mall collapse… that guardian vanishing into the light… Zoe, destroying everything…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380a_30_text: speaker_akali: But then… then there was a voice…
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_10_text: speaker_akali: I don’t even know what it is.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_20_text: speaker_akali: I thought I would stop having dreams of the invasion… but they never went away.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380b_30_text: speaker_akali: And now… I think the memories drew something to me. Something really, really bad.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, that guy who worked at the bakery. He’s been missing for a couple of weeks.
chapter_1_act_2_scene_380c_30_text: speaker_akali: Really? That can’t be connected… right?
akali_2_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: [She’s ten minutes late. I’m starting to think she isn’t going to show.]
akali_2_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [What did she want to talk about anyways?]
akali_2_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: [Something so important that she’d call an “Emergency Star Guardian Meeting...”]
akali_2_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: [And then not even bother to come?]
akali_2_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: [Maybe I’m being too hard on her. Maybe she just forgot. Maybe…]
akali_2_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: [But just to be sure…]
akali_2_scene_120_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Oh, hello, Miss Kai’Sa! One bowl of miso coming up—
akali_2_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not here to eat, Noodle Bill. I’m looking for Akali.
akali_2_scene_140_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Hhrm. That’s odd. She was right here.
akali_2_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course. She vanished, huh?
akali_2_scene_160_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Suppose so. Not sure what to do with this half-eaten bowl though...
akali_2_scene_170_text: speaker_akali: Bill! Could I get a take-away thingy? I could chow down on this food all day.
akali_2_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: Oh. Uh… Hey, Kai’Sa.
akali_2_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: What are you doing here?
akali_2_scene_200_text: speaker_akali: …Eating noodles? It’s Noodle Bill’s. Noodle is right there in the name.
akali_2_scene_210_text: speaker_kaisa: You asked me to meet you in the park. You said it was an emergency.
akali_2_scene_220_text: speaker_akali: Did I? That doesn’t sound like me.
akali_2_scene_230_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, I guess you’re right. You’re more the “hide from your problems” type.
akali_2_scene_240_text: speaker_akali: Hey, I have a particular set of skills. And, like, fifty different kinds of star knives.
akali_2_scene_250_text: speaker_noodle_bill: One bowl to go—
akali_2_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: I don’t get you, Akali.
akali_2_scene_270_text: speaker_noodle_bill: —Oh look, my chicken feet are running away. Better go catch them.
akali_2_scene_280_text: speaker_akali: Not much to get. I sleep, I study, I eat ramen…
akali_2_scene_290_text: speaker_akali: I fight the forces of darkness…
akali_2_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: And you do it all without a care in the world.
akali_2_scene_310_text: speaker_akali: Oh, I care. I care a lot.
akali_2_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: You constantly miss training, you fall asleep in class, you spend all your free time here—
akali_2_scene_330_text: speaker_kaisa: So what is it that you care about?
akali_2_scene_350_text: speaker_akali: Sorry I don’t care enough. Should I act more like you?
akali_2_scene_360_text: speaker_akali: Should I follow my friends around like a little bunny, desperate for them to like me?
akali_2_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m trying to lead a team. These exercises are important.
akali_2_scene_380_text: speaker_akali: I don’t think that’s it. I think you’re trying to lead Lux’s team. I think you’re trying to lead Ahri’s team.
akali_2_scene_390_text: speaker_akali: But we can’t be them. I’m not Janna, or Poppy, or Soraka, or Sarah Fortune. I’m me. And you’re you. Our squad doesn't even have matching gem shapes!
akali_2_scene_400_text: speaker_akali: You’re chasing someone else’s standards. And those guys aren’t here to pat you on the head and tell you what a good little Star Guardian you are.

akali_2_scene_410_text: speaker_akali: We’re in high school. And there are things out there that want to kill us, whether you like it or not. We’re gonna lose someone, someday, and no amount of rules following can stop it.
akali_2_scene_430_text: speaker_akali: Sorry, was that too real? I know how much you like never talking about this.
akali_2_scene_450_text: speaker_akali: My jokes are smart, though. College-graduate-level smart.
akali_2_scene_460_text: speaker_akali: They go to medical school. Call me Nurse Akali, because I—
akali_2_scene_470_text: speaker_kaisa: So what is it you wanted to talk about? How we’re all going to die?
akali_2_scene_480_text: speaker_akali: …I mean, yeah, I guess?
akali_2_scene_490_text: speaker_akali: You don’t acknowledge how scary this is. What we do every day.
akali_2_scene_500_text: speaker_kaisa: I thought you loved fighting?
akali_2_scene_510_text: speaker_akali: It’s not the fighting. I signed up for the fighting.
akali_2_scene_530_text: speaker_akali: I have this dream. Different than all the other ones.
akali_2_scene_540_text: speaker_akali: I’m back at the Battle of the Twilight Star.
akali_2_scene_550_text: speaker_akali: People are screaming out for help.
akali_2_scene_560_text: speaker_akali: I reach for my weapon… but it’s not there.
akali_2_scene_570_text: speaker_akali: I look down and realize I’m in my school uniform.
akali_2_scene_580_text: speaker_akali: I’m not a guardian.
akali_2_scene_590_text: speaker_akali: Suddenly, the screams fade away. I know they’re still there… but I can’t hear them.
akali_2_scene_600_text: speaker_akali: I should feel bad. Horrible, even. But I don’t.
akali_2_scene_620_text: speaker_kaisa: And then you wake up?
akali_2_scene_630_text: speaker_akali: No, I hit the snooze button a couple more times.
akali_2_scene_650_text: speaker_akali: Have you ever thought about what it’s like to fall?
akali_2_scene_670_text: speaker_akali: It must be horrible. Right? That’s why we keep having those bad dreams, that’s why I keep hearing things…
akali_2_scene_680_text: speaker_akali: To burn out… to become… something else. Or fade away entirely. Is that what Zoe was? A Star Guardian who fell? She seemed pretty happy about it.
akali_2_scene_690_text: speaker_akali: I want to be a team player, Kai. But you never want to talk about that night. Or what the old guardians actually went through.
akali_2_scene_700_text: speaker_akali: So… sometimes it’s easier for me to imagine what it’s like to fall…
akali_2_scene_710_text: speaker_akali: …than it is for me to imagine doing… that… forever.
akali_2_scene_720_text: speaker_kaisa: We’re still new at it. Even Lux struggled—
akali_2_scene_730_text: speaker_akali: And Ahri made plenty of mistakes. We met two of them. Actually… did I see Xayah the other day? No, that can’t be right…
akali_2_scene_740_text: speaker_kaisa: Exactly! We’re just like the old guardians!
akali_2_scene_750_text: speaker_akali: …No, we’re not like the old guardians! Listen to what I’m saying!
akali_2_scene_760_text: speaker_kaisa: I am listening! You don’t have to be like them!
akali_2_scene_770_text: speaker_akali: Yeah, and neither do you.
akali_2_scene_800_text: speaker_akali: Ah… hey, I’m being a total bummer. I should go home. Let’s forget we had this conversation, okay? No harm, no foul.
akali_2_scene_440a_10_text: speaker_akali: I never got pulling punches.
akali_2_scene_440a_20_text: speaker_akali: What’s the point of hitting if it doesn’t hurt?
akali_2_scene_440a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, I don’t know… You can spare your friend’s feelings?
akali_2_scene_440a_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Though I do prefer honesty over constantly deflecting with stupid jokes.
akali_2_scene_440b_10_text: speaker_akali: Thanks. It was totally intentional.
akali_2_scene_440b_20_text: speaker_akali: Definitely not a defense mechanism triggered by my best friend attacking me.
akali_2_scene_440b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.
akali_2_scene_440c_10_text: speaker_akali: I do not sound like that.
akali_2_scene_440c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, I guess your nihilism usually falls on the more depressing, less philosophical side of the spectrum.
akali_2_scene_440c_30_text: speaker_akali: Sorry, what? My doesn’t-care-slacker brain is too small for your big, giant words.
akali_2_scene_440c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Ah… and now you’re back to deflecting with sarcasm and stupid jokes.
ekko_3_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: [So, our first test didn’t work. The machine puttered out, generating some weird, blue gas.]
ekko_3_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: [Second test failed, too. And the third.]
ekko_3_scene_30_text: speaker_ekko: Inventor’s Log: This is ChronoDisplacer Test 143.
ekko_3_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [Yeah, we’ve been at it for a while.]
ekko_3_scene_50_text: speaker_ekko: After numerous failed attempts with an operator in the present…
ekko_3_scene_60_text: speaker_ekko: We will now proceed with two travelers, one to monitor an active connection with…
ekko_3_scene_70_text: speaker_kaisa: [It’s hard for me to pay attention when he starts rambling on about all this time stuff.]
ekko_3_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: [But… I’m going with him! He gave me a device to pull us back if anything goes wrong.]
ekko_3_scene_90_text: speaker_ekko: …and, this time, nothing will go wrong.
ekko_3_scene_120_text: speaker_ekko: It’s now or never.
ekko_3_scene_150_text: speaker_ekko: That’s… That’s not a thing.
ekko_3_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Just trying to help.
ekko_3_scene_170_text: speaker_kaisa: …Ahem. Turning on the Stopwatch of Perfect Timing…
ekko_3_scene_180_text: speaker_ekko: Name not final. Patent pending.
ekko_3_scene_190_text: speaker_kaisa: Synchronized! If you’re gonna do something, do it now!
ekko_3_scene_200_text: speaker_ekko: Alright… Here goes nothing!
ekko_3_scene_220_text: speaker_kaisa: Checking the stopwatch to confirm accurate arrival time…
ekko_3_scene_230_text: speaker_ekko: No need. Look at the skyline.
ekko_3_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s… Zoe… the Twilight Star… We’re back to that night…
ekko_3_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: You did it, Ekko.
ekko_3_scene_270_text: speaker_civilian: Wh… What is that?! Run! Run for your lives!
ekko_3_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: Quick, transform. Even if this is the past, that’s still Zoe. The old guardians are fighting her right now, and it is not pretty.
ekko_3_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: Alright, what’s the game plan?
ekko_3_scene_300_text: speaker_ekko: You really weren’t listening to me at all, were you?
ekko_3_scene_310_text: speaker_ekko: We have to track down past me. Ignore everything else. I maaaay have neglected to mention the effects of messing with history too much.
ekko_3_scene_320_text: speaker_kaisa: Those are lies of omission! I… ugh! Just lead the way…
ekko_3_scene_330_text: speaker_past_ekko: Let’s get out of here!
ekko_3_scene_340_text: speaker_claggor: Just a second! My friend needs help!
ekko_3_scene_350_text: speaker_past_ekko: Claggor, hurry! The entire city is falling apart!
ekko_3_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: Wow, you look pretty much the same.
ekko_3_scene_370_text: speaker_ekko: It was last year, Kai. Not last century.
ekko_3_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: True. And that other boy… That’s your friend?
ekko_3_scene_440_text: speaker_kaisa: She hasn’t met us yet. Wouldn’t talking to her mess with—I don’t know—the fabric of reality?!
ekko_3_scene_450_text: speaker_ekko: Oh, so you were listening!
ekko_3_scene_460_text: speaker_kaisa: Only when it was interesting.
ekko_3_scene_470_text: speaker_ekko: …Well, I don’t think she noticed us.
ekko_3_scene_480_text: speaker_kaisa: Maybe not. But he did.
ekko_3_scene_490_text: speaker_claggor: Hey, Sona! Don’t go running off on your own! …Wait, Ekko?
ekko_3_scene_510_text: speaker_claggor: Didn’t I just see you leave? In the opposite direction? …And why are you dressed in cosplay?
ekko_3_scene_520_text: speaker_ekko: I—no—there’s no way. I mean—
ekko_3_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: Sorry, his little computer brain is malfunctioning.
ekko_3_scene_540_text: speaker_kaisa: What he’s trying to say is that he… came back. Wanted to make sure you’re okay.
ekko_3_scene_550_text: speaker_claggor: Yeah, well, nobody is okay right now. Something bad is happening outside… Wait, you’re also dressed in cosplay? This is weird.
ekko_3_scene_570_text: speaker_ekko: …You-you need to get out of here!
ekko_3_scene_580_text: speaker_claggor: Ah. You aren’t my Ekko, are you? Or you are, but… Well, you know.
ekko_3_scene_600_text: speaker_claggor: I always knew you’d figure out a way to time travel! We’ve been talking about it for years!
ekko_3_scene_610_text: speaker_claggor: Did you use a wormhole? Did you figure out a way to alter the geometry of space-time?!
ekko_3_scene_630_text: speaker_claggor: I’m sure you’ll tell future me all about it, right? Right? Ekko… Am I right..?
ekko_3_scene_640_text: speaker_claggor: Wait… Why are you here?
ekko_3_scene_650_text: speaker_ekko: …I’m not going to let it happen. Not again.
ekko_3_scene_660_text: speaker_claggor: What? What happens to me?
ekko_3_scene_680_text: speaker_kaisa: You get hurt. Saving someone else.
ekko_3_scene_690_text: speaker_claggor: Do I look cool while doing it?
ekko_3_scene_700_text: speaker_ekko: This isn’t a joke, Claggor!
ekko_3_scene_710_text: speaker_ekko: I’m-I’m a Star Guardian now. It’s my job to keep you safe.
ekko_3_scene_720_text: speaker_claggor: Huh? What’s a Star Guardian? Are they, like… superheroes?
ekko_3_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s right… The invasion made the guardians public knowledge! Nobody knows they even exist until tomorrow morning!
ekko_3_scene_740_text: speaker_ekko: Yeah, they’re like superheroes. I took an oath and everything…
ekko_3_scene_750_text: speaker_claggor: An oath, huh? Like, protect the innocent, defeat evil? All that?
ekko_3_scene_760_text: speaker_claggor: Which means your job is to protect people. Not keep me from making my own decisions.
ekko_3_scene_770_text: speaker_ekko: But you get hurt!
ekko_3_scene_780_text: speaker_claggor: And what about the person I save? What happens to them if you stop me?
ekko_3_scene_830_text: speaker_ekko: But we traveled all this way!
ekko_3_scene_850_text: speaker_claggor: You’ve read all the same sci-fi mangas as me… You know you can’t change the past.
ekko_3_scene_870_text: speaker_claggor: Why do you think we get along so well?
ekko_3_scene_890_text: speaker_claggor: Yeah… Always. Until the end of time.
ekko_3_scene_920_text: speaker_ekko: No. But I think I will be.
ekko_3_scene_960_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, no problem. I just had to push a button.
ekko_3_scene_110c_10_text: speaker_ekko: No time to explain.
ekko_3_scene_840a_10_text: speaker_ekko: No… I won’t give up.
ekko_3_scene_840a_20_text: speaker_claggor: It’s not giving up, Ekko.
ekko_3_scene_840b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh! I didn’t mean it like that! Don’t worry. You survive… mostly.
ekko_3_scene_840b_30_text: speaker_ekko: But you don’t have to get hurt at all…
ekko_3_scene_840b_50_text: speaker_ekko: No. I won’t give up.
ekko_3_scene_840b_60_text: speaker_claggor: It’s not giving up, Ekko.
ekko_3_scene_840c_10_text: speaker_ekko: The machine works perfectly.
ekko_3_scene_840c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: It almost exploded on trial 104.
ekko_3_scene_840c_30_text: speaker_ekko: We were still working out the kinks.
ekko_3_scene_840c_40_text: speaker_ekko: And it was all for this moment. So, I won’t give up.
ekko_3_scene_840c_50_text: speaker_claggor: It’s not giving up, Ekko.
akali_3_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: [Akali hasn’t talked to me since that last time we hung out…]
akali_3_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: [I… didn’t handle that conversation well. If only Lux…]
akali_3_scene_30_text: speaker_kaisa: [No. No! If only I knew the right thing to say to her.]
akali_3_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [But every time I try to get close… I only push her further away.]
akali_3_scene_50_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Sorry, we don’t open for a—
akali_3_scene_60_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Oh! Kai’Sa! I haven’t seen you in a while! I was starting to get a little worried!
akali_3_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: Don’t worry, I’m not here to eat. I thought maybe Akali would be here.
akali_3_scene_90_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Ah, my most frequent customer. I’m gonna be able to renovate my house thanks to that girl’s appetite, gyah hah!
akali_3_scene_100_text: speaker_noodle_bill: She’s already on her 32nd punch card for a free bowl every eight bowls.
akali_3_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s… oh, I know this…
akali_3_scene_130_text: speaker_noodle_bill: A lot of ramen.
akali_3_scene_140_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You know, she always finds a way to make me laugh. Your friend is very funny.
akali_3_scene_150_text: speaker_kaisa: She talks with you?
akali_3_scene_160_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Oh, sometimes. Other times, she just eats in silence. Tends to be the case with all my customers.
akali_3_scene_170_text: speaker_noodle_bill: But she’ll make this funny face when she’s slurping noodles. Always cracks me up.
akali_3_scene_180_text: speaker_kaisa: I know the one. So focused. Like if she lets a single noodle slip from her mouth…
akali_3_scene_190_text: speaker_noodle_bill: The world will end. Gyah hah!
akali_3_scene_200_text: speaker_kaisa: What... what does she say? When you talk?
akali_3_scene_210_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Don’t worry. She doesn’t spill any of your exciting teenager secrets, whatever they are. Plays a lot of Hyper Crystal Something-or-Other on her phone.

akali_3_scene_220_text: speaker_noodle_bill: She talks a lot about the future. Or… hm… the lack of it. Not as uncommon as you’d think for someone her age. When you’re young, you don’t have much for reference.

akali_3_scene_230_text: speaker_noodle_bill: One bad thing becomes… the only thing, because there’s nothing else to compare it to. She’s real vague about whatever it is. Not that it’s any of my business.
akali_3_scene_250_text: speaker_kaisa: When did I become a person she couldn’t talk to…?
akali_3_scene_260_text: speaker_noodle_bill: A traveler carrying five stones shares their weight with the empty-handed man.
akali_3_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Bill, you can’t keep doing this to me. I have no idea what you’re saying.
akali_3_scene_280_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Gyah hah hah! Teenagers! Your problems are so small, but you think the future of the universe is at stake!
akali_3_scene_300_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Of course! Akali mentioned you’re the leader of your—what was it—ah! Tennis team.
akali_3_scene_310_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Balancing that with school… can’t be easy. I never played tennis, but, you know. I assume.
akali_3_scene_320_text: speaker_noodle_bill: On the other hand, I am an old cook with an abundance of time.
akali_3_scene_330_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I am the empty-handed man. Her problems are the—
akali_3_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: The stones. I get it. And I have my own stones?
akali_3_scene_360_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You just travel with her down that road. Carry your stones together, and I’m sure she’ll come around.
akali_3_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: …Thanks for the weird-but-helpful metaphor. I will.
akali_3_scene_400_text: speaker_akali: Hey, Kai’Sa! Stalking me again?
akali_3_scene_420_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh. Yeah. I know.
akali_3_scene_430_text: speaker_akali: Seriously though, how’d you find me?
akali_3_scene_440_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, you’re not exactly hiding…
akali_3_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: Also the guys at the arcade said you threw a skeeball so hard it broke the machine, then stormed off to “that stupid statue.”
akali_3_scene_460_text: speaker_akali: Threw it overhand. Like in the major leagues.
akali_3_scene_480_text: speaker_akali: So… what? Am I late for training or something?
akali_3_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: Sorry, no, nothing like that. We… we don’t have to talk about Star Guardian stuff. If you don’t want to.
akali_3_scene_520_text: speaker_akali: Though… Do you think they’ll make statues of us one day? You know… if we don’t all, uh, die horribly?
akali_3_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: You know, I’m scared of falling, too.
akali_3_scene_580_text: speaker_kaisa: Of course. I think about the invasion all the time… Rakan died right in front of us… thousands of people lost their lives… and everyone just… moved on.
akali_3_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: I wonder… is that what it’ll always be? Losing people we care about forever… until we lose each other? Ourselves? It doesn’t seem right. It doesn’t seem… fair.

akali_3_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: And part of me wishes I could just go back to before. Before all that happened, before Zoe attacked, before we ever knew there was such a thing as Star Guardians.
akali_3_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: When you and I would hang out at the arcade. Or listen to music in my bedroom.
akali_3_scene_620_text: speaker_akali: Or make friendship bracelets?
akali_3_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah… Man, they’re so janky. So embarrassing. If anyone tries to take mine, I’ll kill them.
akali_3_scene_640_text: speaker_kaisa: Ha! Well… no matter what we do, that old life is gone now.
akali_3_scene_650_text: speaker_kaisa: But the Kai’Sa from before? Your friend Kai’Sa? She’s not gone.
akali_3_scene_660_text: speaker_akali: You’ve been talking to old Bill too much. Did he tell you about the five rocks made of problems or whatever?
akali_3_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: The problem rocks! I still don’t know what he was talking about. Maybe I never will.
akali_3_scene_680_text: speaker_akali: Yeah… You know, it’s kinda funny.
akali_3_scene_690_text: speaker_akali: The danger we face every day. Our oath. The darkness.
akali_3_scene_700_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re right, that is very funny.
akali_3_scene_710_text: speaker_akali: Heh, shut up. It’s all so… overwhelming. And when I’m overwhelmed…
akali_3_scene_720_text: speaker_kaisa: You make a joke?
akali_3_scene_730_text: speaker_akali: Yeah! A really stupid one. Like, I call a pigeon a sky goblin.
akali_3_scene_750_text: speaker_akali: A sky goblin! Because they gobble treasure and tell riddles!
akali_3_scene_760_text: speaker_kaisa: Ak.. ahaha.. Akali… what do you think a goblin is?
akali_3_scene_770_text: speaker_akali: I know what a goblin is! Hey, stop laughing! You’re gonna make me… ahaha!
akali_3_scene_780_text: speaker_kaisa: Ah… oh… oh… my sides…
akali_3_scene_790_text: speaker_akali: Ahhh, whew. Hey… whatever happens… let’s just try to be there for each other, okay? You did promise, after all.
akali_3_scene_800_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re right, Kali. I did.
akali_3_scene_810_text: speaker_akali: Friends ‘til the end? Even if that end super turbo sucks?
akali_3_scene_820_text: speaker_kaisa: You and me, Kali. Until the sucky, turbo end.
akali_3_scene_530a_10_text: speaker_akali: How can you be so sure?
akali_3_scene_530a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: But I know you wouldn’t be doing this if all you cared about was a statue.
akali_3_scene_530a_40_text: speaker_akali: Yeah, I’m more of a billboard person. Captures my image better.
akali_3_scene_530b_10_text: speaker_akali: Yeah… you’re probably right.
akali_3_scene_530b_20_text: speaker_akali: It’s easier if we don’t try to live up to Lux’s standards.
akali_3_scene_530b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Yeah, you were right. We can forge our own path.
akali_3_scene_530b_40_text: speaker_akali: I want to be the first Star Guardian with an instant noodle brand. So much sodium your heart explodes right there at the table.
akali_3_scene_530c_10_text: speaker_akali: Ooh, and at night, there’s a water show set to music.
akali_3_scene_530c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: They can play our theme song! You know, the… burning one? Oh, no… I don’t know the theme song!
akali_3_scene_530c_30_text: speaker_akali: You?! You, little miss leader, don’t know Burning Bright?
akali_3_scene_530c_40_text: speaker_akali: This is an incredible day. Wow. I’m telling the entire squad. Nonnegotiable.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_10_text: speaker_morgana: My, my. What a quaint little street.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_20_text: speaker_morgana: They must have worked quickly to repair the damage after that brat botched her invasion last year. Hmph, what a waste.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_30_text: speaker_morgana: And what did they replace all those buildings with, hm? Rows and rows of shops?

chapter_1_act_3_scene_40_text: speaker_morgana: Hmhmhm! As ever, these humans bend themselves toward such casual cruelties. Wealth extraction! It seems so antithetical to the entire Star Guardian ideal.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_50_text: speaker_morgana: But what do I know? I'm a soon-to-be lowly homeroom teacher at a… public school. [Shiver!]
chapter_1_act_3_scene_60_text: speaker_morgana: Well, enough idling. I suppose it’s time to make a mess of things.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_70_text: speaker_morgana: Gentlemen… the floor is yours.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_90_text: speaker_woman: N... no way! It’s a bunch of monsters!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_100_text: speaker_man: Stay back! S… stop! Someone help!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_110_text: speaker_morgana: Here’s your first test, guardians. Let’s hope you pass.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_120_text: speaker_ekko: Akali! Keep your head in the game! This is what guardians do!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_130_text: speaker_akali: Those are actual monsters! I don’t… I can’t focus… because of that stupid Fiddlesticks thing, ugh!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_140_text: speaker_man: P-please! Don’t hurt me! Waaaaagh!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_150_text: speaker_woman: Where are the Star Guardians?! Where is Lux?! Help us!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_160_text: speaker_ekko: Ugh. Lux isn’t here anymore. Wish she was, but…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_170_text: speaker_ekko: Shoot. There are way too many of those things. People are going to get hurt.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_180_text: speaker_ekko: You ready to put it all on the line, ‘Kali? We might not come back alive.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_190_text: speaker_akali: A…alive?! What do you mean? You think we might die out there?!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_200_text: speaker_ekko: Hey, maybe! But we’re Star Guardians!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_210_text: speaker_ekko: Or at least we’re supposed to be.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_220_text: speaker_akali: Why is everyone obsessed about what a Star Guardian is supposed to be? Are Star Guardians supposed to be killed by monsters?!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_230_text: speaker_akali: I just didn’t think… Ugh, this reminds me of last year… I don’t…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m not feeling that overwhelming sense of dread… It must not be here.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_290_text: speaker_akali: Whew… that’s a relief.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: I sense that woman, though… She was here. Morgana.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: Kali? Are you good? We need you for this, okay?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_320_text: speaker_akali: …I-I don’t… I don’t want…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_330_text: speaker_akali: Hm! Yeah, I’ll be fine. The mission comes first.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: Glad you’re with us, then. And don’t worry… I’ll keep you safe.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_350_text: speaker_akali: Pfft… Yeah… I know you will. You’re a Star Guardian. It’s what you do!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_360_text: speaker_ekko: Oh, my God. Fight now! Talk later!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_370_text: speaker_akali: Whatever, boy genius. Let’s see what you’ve got out there.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: I have Sona and Taliyah covering both ends of the street, so nothing is getting in or out.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_390_text: speaker_kaisa: Check your angles, and prioritize saving anyone in danger. We’re going in!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_400_text: speaker_akali: It’s the big show, everyone! Get ready to make a statement!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_410_text: speaker_ekko: Excuse me, but I’m Ekko.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_420_text: speaker_ekko: I always make a statement.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: We’re not just guardians in training anymore! Let’s show this city we’re real heroes!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_440_text: speaker_ekko: Welcome to VC! Now, get out!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_450_text: speaker_akali: Cut through everything! Don’t let these chumps touch you!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_460_text: speaker_akali: Ha… ha… Okay, maybe that wasn’t as bad as I...
chapter_1_act_3_scene_470_text: speaker_akali: …Wait, did we do it?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_480_text: speaker_ekko: I think so? I don’t see any more monsters.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: And all that stuff that was warping the street is gone. I hesitate to say it, but…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_510_text: speaker_chiizu: OUR FIRST REAL VICTORY! …Is what Miss Sona said. Right, Miss Sona?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_520_text: speaker_taliyah: That was crazy! I was over there, like, fwoom! And then Sona was, like, bwong! And you guys were, like, boooom! It was awesome!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_530_text: speaker_taliyah: Semi-related, but there is a huge magical wall blocking the end of the street that I may have put there and cannot remove. We should go.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_540_text: speaker_akali: You’re never this amped at school, Tali.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_550_text: speaker_taliyah: Because I don’t have star powers or a cool outfit there, duh. Also, I smashed this monster with a huge rock, and it was like, “Bleeeurgh”.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_560_text: speaker_kaisa: …Thanks, everyone. Let’s get out of here before people start to notice what we look like.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_570_text: speaker_ekko: Aw, come on. I wanna be a bootleg action figure like Rakan or that blonde dude… Ezmorp? You know, the blue one.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: We can save it for a victory meal tomorrow, alright?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_610_text: speaker_akali: Boooooo! We want a speech, or to be bootleg Star Guardian action figures with weird names!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_620_text: speaker_kaisa: If we leave now, I’ll do the speech tomorrow at Noodle Bill’s.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_630_text: speaker_akali: Noodle Bill’s?! Everyone go home! We’re done here!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_640_text: speaker_ekko: Wow, she moves fast.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_650_text: speaker_kaisa: Lady likes her noodles.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: One thing I need to ask, though… Did it feel like this was a test? Those things went down… almost too easily.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_670_text: speaker_ekko: Hey, why overthink it?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_690_text: speaker_chiizu: Let’s just bask in our very first victory!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_710_text: speaker_chiizu: WHAT DID I SAY WRONG?! WAS IT BASK?! I HAVE A VERY LARGE VOCABULARY!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_720_text: speaker_taliyah: Heh. But, yeah… makes you wonder…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_730_text: speaker_taliyah: Who else might be watching us?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_10_text: speaker_ekko: Monsters, tons of them. They’re kinda puny by themselves, but there are at least a few dozen out there.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_20_text: speaker_akali: We don’t know where they came from. And everything’s all… messed up… like when that creepy monster attacked us.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I was wondering about that. The pattern looks familiar… What was that creature’s name? Fiddlesticks?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270a_40_text: speaker_ekko: Ugh, I don’t wanna think about that thing. It showed up in my dreams… I’ll never forget that voice…
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_10_text: speaker_ekko: Copy that, Cap’n Kai. What’s the big plan?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Hm. Looks like a few dozen of them, and they’re coming out of that checkerboard goop.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_30_text: speaker_kaisa: Sweep the street. We hit fast and hard, and close that breach.
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_40_text: speaker_ekko: Got it. What do we do if that Fiddlesticks thing shows up?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270b_50_text: speaker_akali: Ugh… Do you think it will?
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270c_10_text: speaker_ekko: Not the time, Kai’Sa!
chapter_1_act_3_scene_270c_40_text: speaker_ekko: Yeah, yeah, very funny. That pattern on the street looks a lot like Fiddlesticks, so if we run into it, maybe it’ll share your sense of humor.
ekko_1_scene_10_text: speaker_prof_ikari: Alright, there’s no way you’ll be able to compute this equation at such a speed.
ekko_1_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [Hm. Professor Ikari’s been testing Ekko to see if he can answer different math problems… before she can type them into a calculator.]
ekko_1_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: [He’s using his Star Guardian powers right out in the open. Idiot!]
ekko_1_scene_60_text: speaker_prof_ikari: 38,472,938 multiplied by 238,492. You have—
ekko_1_scene_90_text: speaker_ekko: What can I say? This man’s got all the answers.
ekko_1_scene_110_text: speaker_akali: If I could rewind time, I definitely wouldn’t use it to impress my math class.
ekko_1_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: You’d probably go back to last week, when you fell on your face in front of the entire class.
ekko_1_scene_130_text: speaker_akali: Akali, you fool! Why didn’t you double knot your laces?!
ekko_1_scene_140_text: speaker_kaisa: …Do you think we should talk to him?
ekko_1_scene_150_text: speaker_akali: Ekko? What, for the answers to the big test on Friday?
ekko_1_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: No! Talk to him about misusing his Star Guardian abilities.
ekko_1_scene_170_text: speaker_akali: This again? You worry too much. I mean, it’s not like he’s gonna get caught.
ekko_1_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: And even if he does, he can just rewind time to before he gets caught. Problem solved.
ekko_1_scene_200_text: speaker_kaisa: Being a Star Guardian is about responsibility. Honor. Loyal—
ekko_1_scene_210_text: speaker_akali: I took the oath the same day as you. We’re co-leaders. Not that anyone seems to remember…
ekko_1_scene_220_text: speaker_akali: If it’s bugging you so much, go talk to the kid. Use your powers of being a giant buzzkill.
ekko_1_scene_240_text: speaker_kaisa: [There he is… It's like he’s avoiding me…]
ekko_1_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Been asking around for you. Feel like I keep showing up right after you leave.
ekko_1_scene_280_text: speaker_kaisa: Chess club, advanced physics…
ekko_1_scene_290_text: speaker_ekko: I try to keep busy.
ekko_1_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: How strange. I sort of have that problem, too…
ekko_1_scene_310_text: speaker_ekko: I can’t hang out this weekend.
ekko_1_scene_320_text: speaker_ekko: I have a… project I’m working on.
ekko_1_scene_330_text: speaker_kaisa: I didn’t ask you to hang out.
ekko_1_scene_340_text: speaker_ekko: Oh. Well, you were going to.
ekko_1_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: You’ve already had this conversation before, haven’t you?
ekko_1_scene_360_text: speaker_ekko: Just a few times.
ekko_1_scene_370_text: speaker_ekko: There were a couple repeats where I managed to sneak away. Those were my favorites.
ekko_1_scene_390_text: speaker_kaisa: You can’t keep doing this, Ekko. Rewinding conversations so you say the right thing. Rewinding math class so you have the right answer…
ekko_1_scene_400_text: speaker_ekko: I’m not cheating at math! Why do you always say that?
ekko_1_scene_420_text: speaker_ekko: No. I’m just good at solving advanced equations in my head.
ekko_1_scene_430_text: speaker_kaisa: [Huh. Guess that makes sense. The kid is a brainiac, after all.]
ekko_1_scene_450_text: speaker_kaisa: But my point stands.
ekko_1_scene_460_text: speaker_ekko: And what point was that… captain?
ekko_1_scene_470_text: speaker_kaisa: My point was that, as your cap… Ugh, I’m telling you to only use your abilities to…
ekko_1_scene_500_text: speaker_ekko: Wasn’t a guess. And… you don’t have to worry. I can never change the past anyways. Not when it really matters.
ekko_1_scene_510_text: speaker_ekko: Look… I should get going.
ekko_1_scene_540_text: speaker_ekko: See you around, Captain ‘Kai.
ekko_1_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: [I’m not giving up on you that easy, kid.]
ekko_1_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: [Okay, so following Ekko home might not have been a high point for me as a Star Guardian…]
ekko_1_scene_580_text: speaker_kaisa: [...but I have to figure out what he’s up to.]
ekko_1_scene_590_text: speaker_strange_machine: Wooooooshh. Icka icka icka icka…
ekko_1_scene_610_text: speaker_ekko: Huh. You’re earlier than last time… captain.
ekko_1_scene_530a_10_text: speaker_ekko: It’s a surprise. Or a… secret.
ekko_1_scene_530b_10_text: speaker_ekko: You seriously want to cheat off me?
ekko_1_scene_530b_20_text: speaker_ekko: After making me feel bad for cheating?
ekko_1_scene_530b_30_text: speaker_ekko: When I didn’t even cheat?
ekko_1_scene_530b_40_text: speaker_kaisa: I-I wasn’t going to cheat. I just wanted to… compare answers.
ekko_1_scene_530c_10_text: speaker_ekko: “That wasn’t what I was gonna say. “
ekko_1_scene_530c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: That wasn’t what I was gonna s—
ekko_1_scene_530c_30_text: speaker_kaisa: I was… gonna… say “I—”
sona_1_scene_10_text: speaker_school_bell: [RING RONG RING RONG. DING DONG DING DONG.]
sona_1_scene_20_text: speaker_akali: Kai’Sa, is she here?
sona_1_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: [The school year just started…]
sona_1_scene_50_text: speaker_kaisa: [...but Sona’s already shown up late to most of her classes.]
sona_1_scene_60_text: speaker_akali: Eventually, Professor Chuba will notice.
sona_1_scene_90_text: speaker_kaisa: Not today, he won’t.
sona_1_scene_100_text: speaker_kaisa: She’s so quiet… How does she manage to move without making any noise?
sona_1_scene_110_text: speaker_akali: This is ridiculous! I trained for so long, and Sona’s naturally that stealthy? UGH!
sona_1_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: Do I sense jealousy, Akali?
sona_1_scene_130_text: speaker_akali: I could sneak past any teacher if I wanted.
sona_1_scene_140_text: speaker_akali: I just prefer to arrive on time.
sona_1_scene_160_text: speaker_kaisa: Maybe you’d be better at sneaking if you learned to be quiet every once in a while.
sona_1_scene_170_text: speaker_akali: Maybe bleh bleh blergh.
sona_1_scene_180_text: speaker_prof_chuba: Yesterday, we left off talking about the different types of chemical bonds.
sona_1_scene_190_text: speaker_prof_chuba: Can anyone tell me what a covalent bond is?
sona_1_scene_210_text: speaker_kaisa: [Ulp! You have got to be kidding me!]
sona_1_scene_230_text: speaker_prof_chuba: …A covalent bond is when two atoms share electrons.
sona_1_scene_240_text: speaker_prof_chuba: It’s my personal favorite bond. Aside from my bond with Mrs. Chuba!
sona_1_scene_260_text: speaker_prof_chuba: A little teacher humor there. Anybody? No? Well, moving on…
sona_1_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Okay, I mean, sure, his speech was cheesy, but the professor did sort of make me realize something.
sona_1_scene_280_text: speaker_akali: Inertia is a property of matter?
sona_1_scene_290_text: speaker_kaisa: Inertia is the… Were we at the same lecture?
sona_1_scene_300_text: speaker_akali: Nope. I was on my phone. They added new levels in Hyper Crystal Dungeon Mobile.
sona_1_scene_310_text: speaker_kaisa: I need to get to know Sona better.
sona_1_scene_320_text: speaker_akali: How did you get that from a science class?
sona_1_scene_330_text: speaker_kaisa: Working together, combining the best parts of a thing to make an even more powerful whole.
sona_1_scene_340_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s just like being Star Guardians.
sona_1_scene_350_text: speaker_akali: This again. So now you’re using chemistry as an excuse to hang out with your team?
sona_1_scene_370_text: speaker_akali: Okay, but why Sona and not, for instance, me?
sona_1_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: I already know you too well.
sona_1_scene_390_text: speaker_akali: Hmph. I guess that’s fair.
sona_1_scene_400_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh! Here she comes! I’ll, uh… talk to you later!
sona_1_scene_410_text: speaker_akali: Oh… Bye, I guess?
sona_1_scene_450_text: speaker_sona: [Sona rotates her wrist rapidly back and forth.]
sona_1_scene_460_text: speaker_kaisa: Does that mean so-so?
sona_1_scene_480_text: speaker_kaisa: Nice! We are in agreement… I think!
sona_1_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: By the way… Akali and I noticed that you’ve been late to class a couple times.
sona_1_scene_500_text: speaker_kaisa: It’s not a huge deal. As long as you aren’t late to our battles against the forces of darkness.
sona_1_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: Well, if you want to, erm… tell me about it—what’s going on—I’m here.
sona_1_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: [Oh, shoot. I don’t know sign language!]
sona_1_scene_560_text: speaker_chiizu: It’s the people, Miss Kai’Sa. They’re running around like mice in a maze!
sona_1_scene_570_text: speaker_kaisa: Chiizu?! You shouldn’t be here! You’ll give us away!
sona_1_scene_580_text: speaker_chiizu: I’ve been here every day! To most non-guardians, I’m invisible unless they know what they’re looking for. Nobody can see me!
sona_1_scene_590_text: speaker_chiizu: Not even you, Miss Kai’Sa! …Except for right now. When you can. Because we’re talking.
sona_1_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: Interesting. Must be why nobody ever mentions the other familiars…
sona_1_scene_610_text: speaker_chiizu: But you’re right. It’s too dangerous for me to be talking here… If anyone notices, they might focus on me. And that would blow our cover!
sona_1_scene_620_text: speaker_chiizu: Meet Miss Sona and I at the mall. We’ll explain everything.
sona_1_scene_640_text: speaker_chiizu: And by we, I of course mean… she! She will explain everything! I’m just a humble translator!
sona_1_scene_650_text: speaker_chiizu: I gotta get outta here! Squeak!
sona_1_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh. Well, I guess I’ll meet you two… later, then? Please don’t kill each other?
sona_1_scene_670_text: speaker_sona: [Sona waves goodbye, then turns angrily toward Chiizu.]
sona_1_scene_680_text: speaker_chiizu: RUN AWAY! SHE’S BRIMMING WITH RAGE!
sona_1_scene_700_text: speaker_another_student: Professor, one of the lab rats escaped!
sona_1_scene_710_text: speaker_a_third_student: Sona was chasing it through the hall! And I think it was wearing… glasses?!
sona_1_scene_220a_10_text: speaker_prof_chuba: I mean… yes. That’s technically correct.
sona_1_scene_220a_30_text: speaker_prof_chuba: But not the answer I was looking for.
sona_1_scene_220b_40_text: speaker_prof_chuba: Hmm… I thought so.
sona_1_scene_220c_10_text: speaker_prof_chuba: Are you saying you don’t know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_30_text: speaker_prof_chuba: No, you don’t know the answer? Or no, you know the answer?
sona_1_scene_220c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: I invoke my right to an attorney.
sona_3_scene_10_text: speaker_kaisa: [Okay, so my last attempt to help Sona didn’t go so hot.]
sona_3_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: [But now… I’ve got a new plan of attack.]
sona_3_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, come on! Now, of all times?!
sona_3_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: I think we’re going to have to postpone our coffee date. Unless that gross monster likes maid cafes.
sona_3_scene_80_text: speaker_chiizu: Of course, Miss Kai’Sa. Should we call the other guardians?
sona_3_scene_90_text: speaker_kaisa: Hmm… This thing doesn’t seem like too big a threat. I think we can take it down.
sona_3_scene_110_text: speaker_chiizu: “I don’t know. He seems pretty big to me.”
sona_3_scene_120_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona, just say the word, and I’ll call them.
sona_3_scene_130_text: speaker_kaisa: But we can do it alone. I’ve watched you train… You’re a lot stronger than you think.
sona_3_scene_150_text: speaker_chiizu: Miss Sona says, “I’m not so sure.”
sona_3_scene_160_text: speaker_chiizu: …Erm, this may not be the time… what with the monster and all… and I don’t want to editorialize again…
sona_3_scene_170_text: speaker_chiizu: But Miss Kai’sa, there is more to Miss Sona’s story…
sona_3_scene_180_text: speaker_chiizu: During the attack, Miss Sona couldn’t move.
sona_3_scene_190_text: speaker_chiizu: She would have been hurt,or even killed, if not for the bravery of a boy…
sona_3_scene_200_text: speaker_chiizu: Someone no older than us. And not one of the Star Guardians… just a boy, with no extraordinary powers.
sona_3_scene_230_text: speaker_chiizu: He… well. If she’d had the light of the First Star then… maybe he wouldn’t have had to save her. And he wouldn’t have been hurt keeping her safe.
sona_3_scene_250_text: speaker_chiizu: I’m sorry, Miss Sona. I promise I won’t say more if you don’t want me to.
sona_3_scene_260_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona… I’m so sorry. I had no idea. But… just because you didn’t have the power to help him then, doesn’t mean you can’t help others now.
sona_3_scene_270_text: speaker_kaisa: Being a Star Guardian doesn’t make you brave. Being brave is what makes you a Star Guardian.
sona_3_scene_300_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh, I know this one! Hang on, let me try this…
sona_3_scene_330_text: speaker_kaisa: Nailed it. Now… you ready to kick monster butt?
sona_3_scene_360_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh, the air raid siren is going off, too? Come on!
sona_3_scene_370_text: speaker_kaisa: Wait… Sona, I was wrong before!
sona_3_scene_380_text: speaker_kaisa: You shouldn’t try to focus on one sound.
sona_3_scene_390_text: speaker_kaisa: And you shouldn’t try to shut them out, either!
sona_3_scene_410_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re a composer, right? Listen to the music of the city!
sona_3_scene_470_text: speaker_kaisa: Good. Use it. Now, let’s mop up that giant freak before the cafe closes.
sona_3_scene_500_text: speaker_kaisa: Huff… huff… piece of cake!
sona_3_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh, I shouldn’t have said that. Burned a lot of calories out there. Now, I want cake.
sona_3_scene_530_text: speaker_kaisa: Sona! You killed it! Literally! Your music powers are so strong!
sona_3_scene_540_text: speaker_chiizu: Miss Sona was incredible! She was all, “Bang! Pow! Pow!” And the monster was all, “SCREEEECH!”
sona_3_scene_550_text: speaker_kaisa: Heh. I see you’ve been hanging out with Taliyah.
sona_3_scene_560_text: speaker_chiizu: Chu chu, star powers!
sona_3_scene_570_text: speaker_sona: [“It was a thrilling battle, Captain.”]
sona_3_scene_580_text: speaker_kaisa: [Sign language! And you understand it now! Okay, Kai’Sa… you got this.]
sona_3_scene_590_text: speaker_kaisa: [You’ve been practicing your signs. You’ve done your homework. The moment is perfect. Please don’t screw it up…]
sona_3_scene_610_text: speaker_kaisa: I’ll just have to take your word for it, Chiizu.
sona_3_scene_620_text: speaker_chiizu: I’m impressed, Miss Kai’Sa. Your sign language has greatly improved!
sona_3_scene_630_text: speaker_kaisa: A captain’s got to be able to communicate with her team.
sona_3_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m here for you. We all are. I know it won’t always be easy…
sona_3_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: Some days, you might not be able to handle the crowds.
sona_3_scene_690_text: speaker_kaisa: [“Just take it one… note at a time.”]
sona_3_scene_700_text: speaker_sona: [“You don’t know anything about music, do you?”]
sona_3_scene_710_text: speaker_kaisa: I know about autotune. Does that count?
sona_3_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: [“Maybe you can teach me?”]
sona_3_scene_750_text: speaker_chiizu: Ooh! I’ll get my wood block!
sona_3_scene_760_text: speaker_chiizu: Don’t start the lesson without me! The great wood block musician and interpreter extraordinaire, Chiizu! Squeak!
sona_3_scene_420a_10_text: speaker_chiizu: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!
sona_3_scene_420b_10_text: speaker_chiizu: I see, Miss Kai’Sa! It’s all part of a symphony!
sona_3_scene_420c_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Is it not called the skinny trumpet?! Who told me…? Ekko. I swear, when this is over...
sona_3_scene_420c_30_text: speaker_chiizu: But I see…! It’s all part of a symphony.
sona_3_scene_600a_20_text: speaker_chiizu: Sona is thankful, Miss Kai’Sa.
sona_3_scene_600a_30_text: speaker_chiizu: Yeah, I know you understood her without me! But I’m not giving up my job! This economy is brutal!
sona_3_scene_600b_10_text: speaker_sona: [“My music is more of a solo act.”]
sona_3_scene_600b_20_text: speaker_chiizu: Sona… will think about it, Miss Kai’Sa.
sona_3_scene_600b_30_text: speaker_chiizu: See? That was interpreting for extra politeness. I’m also learning things!
sona_3_scene_600c_10_text: speaker_sona: [Sona signs, “But we should help.”]
sona_3_scene_600c_20_text: speaker_chiizu: Sona would like to stay. For a little while.
sona_3_scene_600c_30_text: speaker_chiizu: At least until people start to gather. Our cover can’t be blown yet, squeak!
akali_1_scene_10_text: speaker_akali: Mrph… gulp… urp… so good.
akali_1_scene_20_text: speaker_kaisa: Slow down, Akali. Those noodles aren’t going anywhere.
akali_1_scene_30_text: speaker_akali: Mrnch… ulp… Yeah they are. Into my… mrmph…. mouth.
akali_1_scene_40_text: speaker_kaisa: You’re gonna get a stomachache. And we have training later—
akali_1_scene_50_text: speaker_akali: And the award for best impression of my dad goes to…
akali_1_scene_60_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m just trying to help.
akali_1_scene_70_text: speaker_akali: Mrmph… slurp…. You know how you can help me?
akali_1_scene_80_text: speaker_kaisa: Ugh, watching this is so gross. How?
akali_1_scene_90_text: speaker_akali: Order me a refill. I’m running low.
akali_1_scene_100_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Nobody runs low on my watch.
akali_1_scene_120_text: speaker_akali: See, someone knows when they’re wanted.
akali_1_scene_140_text: speaker_akali: Mmrmph… slurp… mrnchh… Uh… Bill? Are you still there?
akali_1_scene_170_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I couldn’t help but overhear…
akali_1_scene_180_text: speaker_akali: Oh, c’mon! Not you, too!
akali_1_scene_190_text: speaker_noodle_bill: It’s okay. I’m not here to talk about you. I’ve got problems of my own.
akali_1_scene_200_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I’m sure it doesn’t compare to your little high-school adventures…
akali_1_scene_210_text: speaker_noodle_bill: But for me? This day was pretty memorable.
akali_1_scene_220_text: speaker_akali: Are you going to tell the story, or can I finish eating this like a monster?
akali_1_scene_240_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Every morning, I wake up early to make my broth.
akali_1_scene_250_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I like to read the paper while I let the flavors mix… But today, I felt like taking a walk.
akali_1_scene_280_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Valoran City is peaceful in the early hours of the day. A special sort of quiet.
akali_1_scene_290_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I was enraptured by the smells of fresh bread warming in the oven…
akali_1_scene_300_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Of the light reflecting off tiny droplets of dew on freshly cut grass…
akali_1_scene_310_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Before I knew it, I had spent hours walking through our city, and I found myself in a place that I didn’t recognize…
akali_1_scene_320_text: speaker_noodle_bill: “Oh, no!” I thought. “I must get back to my broth! If it reaches a boil, my hard work—and the day’s profits—will be lost.”

akali_1_scene_330_text: speaker_noodle_bill: But I had been so swept up by beauty on my stroll, that I had not traced my steps. I rushed through the streets, and by sheer luck, I found my way back to my stand.
akali_1_scene_340_text: speaker_noodle_bill: My broth still simmered lightly. All was well.
akali_1_scene_350_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh. That was… evocative.
akali_1_scene_360_text: speaker_akali: Don’t lie to the man, Kai! Bill, what are you even saying? That was your most boring story yet!
akali_1_scene_370_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Gah hah! I appreciate your feedback, Akali.
akali_1_scene_380_text: speaker_noodle_bill: But I think perhaps you both missed the moral of my tale.
akali_1_scene_400_text: speaker_akali: Learn how to use GPS?
akali_1_scene_410_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Trust in your friends.
akali_1_scene_420_text: speaker_kaisa: I’m… not sure I understand.
akali_1_scene_430_text: speaker_akali: Isn’t it obvious, Kai’sa? Bill is saying the pork broth is his friend.
akali_1_scene_460_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Not quite. But friendship is like a good broth.
akali_1_scene_470_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You put in time. And effort. That’s the chicken feet. And love. The pig bones.
akali_1_scene_480_text: speaker_noodle_bill: And you must know that even when you aren’t there… the friendship will simmer on.
akali_1_scene_490_text: speaker_kaisa: Love is like… boiling pig bones?
akali_1_scene_500_text: speaker_akali: Well said, noodle man. Very wise. Love the part about the feet and bones.
akali_1_scene_510_text: speaker_kaisa: You weren’t even listening. You were about to doze off with noodles still in your mouth! Again!
akali_1_scene_520_text: speaker_akali: Sorry, I’m just exhausted from all our late nights training.
akali_1_scene_530_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Training! My, my. What sport do you play?
akali_1_scene_560_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Well, I’m sure you’re both very hard workers! At tennis. The game you both play.
akali_1_scene_580_text: speaker_akali: …Alright, that’s it for me. Thanks for the noodles, Noodle Bill. Tasty as always.
akali_1_scene_590_text: speaker_akali: Kai’sa, you got this one?
akali_1_scene_600_text: speaker_kaisa: But you ordered three bowls…
akali_1_scene_620_text: speaker_kaisa: ...Great. Gonna have to beg dad for more spending money.
akali_1_scene_660_text: speaker_kaisa: I used to be a better friend, but lately…
akali_1_scene_670_text: speaker_kaisa: Life’s just become so complicated.
akali_1_scene_680_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You want some more advice from a wise, old cook?
akali_1_scene_700_text: speaker_noodle_bill: It never gets any easier.
akali_1_scene_720_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Trust in your friend. She trusts in you.
akali_1_scene_730_text: speaker_kaisa: If that’s true, she doesn’t show it.
akali_1_scene_740_text: speaker_noodle_bill: That just means she needs you to trust in her even more. So sayeth Noodle Bill!
akali_1_scene_750_text: speaker_kaisa: Heh. Thanks, Noodle Bill.
akali_1_scene_770_text: speaker_kaisa: Oh… uh… Put it on our tab.
akali_1_scene_710a_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Gah hah! You’re welcome.
akali_1_scene_710a_20_text: speaker_kaisa: But couldn’t it? Get easier, I mean. If I figure out a plan of attack. Face my problems… head on…?
akali_1_scene_710a_30_text: speaker_noodle_bill: You solve one problem, another takes its place.
akali_1_scene_710a_40_text: speaker_kaisa: Heh. Now you sound like Akali.
akali_1_scene_710b_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Gah hah! I didn’t say it was helpful advice.
akali_1_scene_710b_20_text: speaker_kaisa: But if life is so hard… then why do you seem so happy?
akali_1_scene_710b_30_text: speaker_noodle_bill: I have good customers and great friends! Friends like my pork broth.
akali_1_scene_710c_10_text: speaker_noodle_bill: Gah hah! Maybe I should!
akali_1_scene_710c_20_text: speaker_noodle_bill: But if we all did only what was comfortable, the future would be written in stone.
akali_1_scene_710c_30_text: speaker_kaisa: So... I’m just supposed to act impulsively?
akali_1_scene_710c_40_text: speaker_kaisa: That’s more Akali’s thing.
